revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-04 20:48:23.000000000', 'message': 'Set timeouts on uri tasks

uri task has a 30 second timeout by default, and in a greenfield
or new host deploy these tasks are always expected to fail, so the
timeout is expected to be met multiple times.

We should set a small timeout on these tasks to fail quickly.

Change-Id: I6748bbd894585d97cce235e854afbcf9d433d34d
'}]
commit_message:
Set timeouts on uri tasks

uri task has a 30 second timeout by default, and in a greenfield
or new host deploy these tasks are always expected to fail, so the
timeout is expected to be met multiple times.

We should set a small timeout on these tasks to fail quickly.

Change-Id: I6748bbd894585d97cce235e854afbcf9d433d34d

Why would they not share the same service?  afaik the apiserver can be setup to use it's own prefix so i don't see a conflict there [1]?  it's not clear if this is related to writing a plugin or what, can you explain why this is necessary?

[1] https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kube-apiserver/"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2017-11-29 10:59:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

In some setups, etcd is not run as a service, it's run as a container but uses the same port (example kubeadm). We need to support those and be good citizens."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-11-30 19:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 13:25:17.000000000', 'message': 'Switch default etcd port numbers and allow overrides

We should avoid using the default 2379/2380 ports as
it clashes with the etcd(s) used other projects. This
will enable us to run one etcd for devstack and another
for kubernetes in the same box.

commit_message:
Allow overrides for ETCD ports

This will enable us to run one etcd for devstack and another
for kubernetes in the same box if necessary

Change-Id: Ib71ded24727b80afd4d98eb68bade0f8c0f72311

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-01 16:51:40.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I27075c59cd14eb91ec720043222fed4e3a5632ec
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I27075c59cd14eb91ec720043222fed4e3a5632ec

commit_message:
INFINIDAT: add support for multi-attach

Multi-attach has been supported by the InfiniBox for a long time now.
As it is now supported by Cinder, this commit enables this capability
for the driver for attachments done either through Fibre Channel or
through iSCSI.

Change-Id: Ic84eb3d88cc2130192434b3b49e0e53c2717c6b0

commit_message:
`bind_host` and `bind_port` are coming under `api_setting

Option 'bind_host' from group 'DEFAULT' is deprecated for removal[0],
please use option 'bind_host' from group 'api_settings' instead. bind_port
option are the same.
The default value of api_handler is queue_producer, we did not configure
it. So delete api_handler option.

[0]https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/common/config.py#L45

Change-Id: I4e9c1d40bcb497f147ea38d4f3c6d78c181fa20b
Closes-Bug: #1717190
(cherry picked from commit b745d0a6dde27d5f4866870200cacf2165e0e1d3)

Change-Id: Iafaf1cf1d9b0227b0f869969d0bd52fbde3791a0
'}, {'created': '2018-03-08 16:41:04.000000000', 'message': "Use zuul firewall rules in gate

Till now we've been flusing iptables in the gates to allow cross node
communication in the multi node ceph jobs. This raised security
concerns, in particular it exposed memcached to the external net.

This patch uses the infra provided role 'multi-node-firewall' in order
to correctly configure iptables. Thanks to Jeremy Stanley and Jeffrey
for help with this.

Closes-Bug: #1749326
Change-Id: Iafaf1cf1d9b0227b0f869969d0bd52fbde3791a0
"}]
commit_message:
Use zuul firewall rules in gate

Till now we've been flusing iptables in the gates to allow cross node
communication in the multi node ceph jobs. This raised security
concerns, in particular it exposed memcached to the external net.

This patch uses the infra provided role 'multi-node-firewall' in order
to correctly configure iptables. Thanks to Jeremy Stanley and Jeffrey
for help with this.

Closes-Bug: #1749326
Change-Id: Iafaf1cf1d9b0227b0f869969d0bd52fbde3791a0

commit_message:
Add user documentation for JSON Home

Keystone has supported JSON Home documents since Juno, but we never
had any user-facing documentation for the API. This commit adds a
section to the user guide that describes what JSON Home is and adds
an example of how users can get it.

Change-Id: Ib0793f6af4f65e5549ba0543b87d20f3f1a8a62d

commit_message:
Work around deprecations for opportunistic tests

Some of the oslo.db opportunistic sql test classes we were using were
deprecated[1] and it was causing a lot of noise in the log output.
Refactor the tests to use the opportunistic mixin and new fixtures.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/351411/

Change-Id: Iea6d7be5150d608f894625e86d2233e12ba56026

commit_message:
Add backup restoration cancellation support

Backups can be cancelled by force deleting the in-progress backup, but
there is no mechanism to delete the restoring backups.

We will now monitor the status of the backup and on any status change
will abort the restoration and change the volume status to error.

The reason to diverge from the backup creation cancellation
implementation (deleting the new resource) is that the restoring may be
done into an already existing volume and deleting it is not feasable for
the user, for example when an instance is booted from a Cinder volume
and there's a license linked to the System ID.

Cinder backup drivers may now raise BackupRestoreCancel in `restore`
method when a restoring operation is cancelled.

Change-Id: If2f143d7ba56ae2d74b3bb571237cc053f63054e

commit_message:
Add backup cancellation admin doc

We support backup cancellation on many backup drivers but we have no
admin documentation.

This patch adds a brief explanation of the backup cancellation mechanism
as well as some considerations that are good to keep in mind.

Change-Id: I0c38442f01905e0ca0d61e65ee7ea0972ab4ec71

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 17:51:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix leftovers after backup abort

When aborting a backup on any chunked driver we will be leaving chunks
in the backend without Cinder knowing so and with no way of deleting
them from Cinder.  In this case the only way to delete them is going to
the storage itself and deleting them manually.

Another issue that will happen if we are using a temporary resource for
the backup, be it a volume or a snapshot, is that it will not be cleaned
up and will be left for us to manually issue the delete through the
Cinder API.

The first issue is caused by the chunked driver's assumption that the
`refresh` method in an OVO will ignore the context's `read_deleted`
configuration and always read the record, which is not true.  And since
it doesn't work when the record is deleted there will be leftovers if
the status of the backup transitions to deleted during the processing of
a chunk.

The second issue is caused by the same thing, but in this case is when
the backup manager refreshes the backup OVO to know the temporary
resource it needs to clean up.

commit_message:
Fix leftovers after backup abort

When aborting a backup on any chunked driver we will be leaving chunks
in the backend without Cinder knowing so and with no way of deleting
them from Cinder.  In this case the only way to delete them is going to
the storage itself and deleting them manually.

Another issue that will happen if we are using a temporary resource for
the backup, be it a volume or a snapshot, is that it will not be cleaned
up and will be left for us to manually issue the delete through the
Cinder API.

The first issue is caused by the chunked driver's assumption that the
`refresh` method in an OVO will ignore the context's `read_deleted`
configuration and always read the record, which is not true.  And since
it doesn't work when the record is deleted there will be leftovers if
the status of the backup transitions to deleted during the processing of
a chunk.

The second issue is caused by the same thing, but in this case is when
the backup manager refreshes the backup OVO to know the temporary
resource it needs to clean up.

This patches fixes the incorrect behavior of the backup abort mechanism
to prevent leaving things behind.

Closes-Bug: #1746559
Change-Id: Idcfdbf815f404982d26618710a291054f19be736

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-08 14:59:50.000000000', 'message': "Allow configuring tpool size

The RBD driver and almost all backup drivers rely heavily on eventlet's
tpool, which has a default of 20 threads, which will be too low.

Currently the only way to change this is using the environmental
variable EVENTLET_THREADPOOL_SIZE, which isn't very clean for the
openstack services.

This patch adds the possibility of setting specific values for each
backend and for the backup service, and increases the default for the
backup service from 20 threads to 60.

The backup service can be configured under [DEFAULT] section with option
backup_native_threads_pool_size, and the backends under their specific
sections with backend_native_threads_pool_size.

Change-Id: I5d7c1e8d7f1c6592ded1f74eea42d76ab523df92
Closes-Bug: #1754354
"}]
commit_message:
Allow configuring tpool size

The RBD driver and almost all backup drivers rely heavily on eventlet's
tpool, which has a default of 20 threads, which will be too low.

Currently the only way to change this is using the environmental
variable EVENTLET_THREADPOOL_SIZE, which isn't very clean for the
openstack services.

This patch adds the possibility of setting specific values for each
backend and for the backup service, and increases the default for the
backup service from 20 threads to 60.

The backup service can be configured under [DEFAULT] section with option
backup_native_threads_pool_size, and the backends under their specific
sections with backend_native_threads_pool_size.

Change-Id: I5d7c1e8d7f1c6592ded1f74eea42d76ab523df92
Closes-Bug: #1754354

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-26 22:50:07.000000000', 'message': 'Parse endpoint arguments in SolidFire

The SolidFire driver was assuming the same login/password and port
settings when building endpoint info for replication targets.  This
was true even if the config specified these fields as being different
in the config entry for the replication device.

This change updates the private build_endpoint method to actually
read any kwargs passed in to it and use them.

Change-Id: I8f95c891c9ee64fb8dd6b541be15fff539e2ab21
Closes-Bug: #1751917
'}]
commit_message:
Parse endpoint arguments in SolidFire

The SolidFire driver was assuming the same login/password and port
settings when building endpoint info for replication targets.  This
was true even if the config specified these fields as being different
in the config entry for the replication device.

This change updates the private build_endpoint method to actually
read any kwargs passed in to it and use them.

Change-Id: I8f95c891c9ee64fb8dd6b541be15fff539e2ab21
Closes-Bug: #1751917

commit_message:
Remove bogus ID column from ListRoutesAdvertisedBySpeaker

The routes shown by ListRoutesAdvertisedBySpeaker only contain the
destination and the next_hop fields, so drop the ID column that is
always empty anyway.

Change-Id: Idc19ebb55d8eb30e61fd1f9101512279e00b6f0b

commit_message:
Reraise exception on creating container

It is desirable to raise exceptions to upper stack so that it
can be captured and handled. For example, we are introducing
action APIs that will record exception details if there is
an exception that has been raised to the upper stack.
Otherwise, the exception information will lose and the action
will be wrongly recorded as success.

Change-Id: I2737102510e04383c878c47441f46a86fed9d744

commit_message:
Catch specific exception on claim

If resource claim fails, a ResourcesUnavailable exception will
be raised. We can catch this exception instead of catching a
generic exception.

Change-Id: I0bef394ac6c1c01a7b527d49ceb1613b90dcb480

subject: Avoid calling _fail_container in some cases
messages:
[{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-03 20:58:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-03 22:04:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2018-02-05 02:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2018-02-05 02:46:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I still have a concern here. IMO, we should keep it and stop Docker container. If we avoid calling this function, users might not know the raised exception. Setting container's status_reason will make thing clearer for users."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-05 03:02:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> I still have a concern here. IMO, we should keep it and stop Docker
 > container. If we avoid calling this function, users might not know
 > the raised exception. Setting container's status_reason will make
 > thing clearer for users.

Yes, this is a valid point. However, even we set the status and status_reason in the container, they will be override in the next execution of periodic task [1]. My original though is to leverage the container action feature [2] to resolve the issue. If this feature is implemented, there will be an API for users to retrieve the result/error of each actions. However, the container action feature is not fully implemented yet.

Let's give it more thoughts about this.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/service/periodic.py#L48
[2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zun/+spec/container-actions-api"}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2018-02-05 04:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think about the workaround solution. Keep calling _fail_container and stop docker container. Docker container's state will be 'exited'. Then we do some logical changes in _populate_container_states [1] method:

...
elif ((started_at == "" or state.get('Status') == 'exited') and container.status in (consts.CREATED, consts.ERROR)):
     pass
...

What do you think about the above approach?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/container/docker/driver.py#L454'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I think about the workaround solution. Keep calling _fail_container
 > and stop docker container. Docker container's state will be
 > 'exited'. Then we do some logical changes in _populate_container_states
 > [1] method:
 > 
 > ...
 > elif ((started_at == "" or state.get('Status') == 'exited') and
 > container.status in (consts.CREATED, consts.ERROR)):
 > pass
 > ...
 > 
 > What do you think about the above approach?
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/container/docker/driver.py#L454

Kien,

I have been thinking your approach for a while. My major concern is the potential interruption on stopping the container. If an action (i.e. reboot, stop, etc.) fails with a unexpected exception, we don't know what is the exact cause. It might be possible that the container is still health but the error is due to an intermittent network failure. Stopping the container in this case will cause a unnecessary interruption of the user's container which is suboptimal.'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2018-02-06 14:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I understood. Chaolei Li is working on the container action feature, hope that we can have this soon :)'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-02-06 19:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-03 20:58:26.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Avoid calling _fail_container in some cases

Change-Id: I77346ef302ac7c641c798b734e18eac55dacc8bc
'}, {'created': '2018-02-03 22:04:54.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid calling _fail_container in some cases

Remove calling _fail_container in the following methods:
* _do_container_reboot
* _do_container_stop
* _do_container_pause
* _do_container_unpause
* _do_container_kill

This is because _fail_container will set the container to Error
state and do the necessary cleanup. However, the docker container
might be still running in Docker. Therefore, setting it as Error
state might not be correct and lead to state inconsistent between
Zun and Docker.

Change-Id: I77346ef302ac7c641c798b734e18eac55dacc8bc
'}, {'created': '2018-03-04 21:38:30.000000000', 'message': "Avoid calling _fail_container in some cases

This is because _fail_container will set the container to Error
state in DB and do the necessary cleanup. However, the docker
container might be still running in Docker. We treat the states
in Docker as the source of truth and periodically sync Docker
container's states to Zun DB. Therefore, bypassing Docker and
directly changing container's state in DB is bad and might
lead to state inconsistency between Zun and Docker.

Change-Id: I77346ef302ac7c641c798b734e18eac55dacc8bc
"}, {'created': '2018-03-04 21:43:31.000000000', 'message': "Avoid calling _fail_container in some cases

This is because _fail_container will set the container to Error
state in DB and do the necessary cleanup. However, the docker
container might be still running in Docker. We treat the states
in Docker as the source of truth and periodically sync Docker
container's states to Zun DB. Therefore, bypassing Docker and
directly changing container's state in DB is bad and might
lead to state inconsistency between Zun and Docker.

The side effect of this patch is that users cannot query the
result of each action from the container's resource. Users are
recommended to use the new action APIs [1] to achieve the
equivalent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548853/

Depends-On: Ic3fa5e879baa6a5a01a1ae83740a2149a6f8003b
Change-Id: I77346ef302ac7c641c798b734e18eac55dacc8bc
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid calling _fail_container in some cases

This is because _fail_container will set the container to Error
state in DB and do the necessary cleanup. However, the docker
container might be still running in Docker. We treat the states
in Docker as the source of truth and periodically sync Docker
container's states to Zun DB. Therefore, bypassing Docker and
directly changing container's state in DB is bad and might
lead to state inconsistency between Zun and Docker.

The side effect of this patch is that users cannot query the
result of each action from the container's resource. Users are
recommended to use the new action APIs [1] to achieve the
equivalent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548853/

Depends-On: Ic3fa5e879baa6a5a01a1ae83740a2149a6f8003b
Change-Id: I77346ef302ac7c641c798b734e18eac55dacc8bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-06 12:57:48.000000000', 'message': 'Pin ceph apt packages in playbook

ceph_client pins to the upstream repo, but the ceph-ansible roles
do not. So in Pike, UCA has Ceph Luminous (12.x), while we are
attempting to install Jewel (10.x), and this fails since the
ceph packages are not pinned correctly and attempting to source
from UCA.

Change-Id: If244b2efd2ff894e3ef5801ed715e2b00431a83a
Closes-Bug: #1715390

ceph packages are not pinned correctly and attempting to source
from UCA.

Change-Id: If244b2efd2ff894e3ef5801ed715e2b00431a83a

Closes-Bug: #1715390

commit_message:
Pin ceph apt packages in playbook

To maintain consistency with the ceph_client role and ensure Ceph
components are sourced from the correct apt repos, we should pin the
priority for the ceph upstream repos when they are selected to be used
for Ceph installs.

Closes-Bug: #1715390
Change-Id: If244b2efd2ff894e3ef5801ed715e2b00431a83a

subject: Resolve nsenter fork exception
messages:
[{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-07 05:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-07 05:33:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-07 07:16:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-07 17:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

makes sense but lets get the integrated job working to test first'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-07 17:15:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

PID namespace
              Children will have a set of PID to process mappings separate from  the  nsenter  process  (CLONE_NEWPID
              flag).   nsenter  will  fork  by default if changing the PID namespace, so that the new program and its
              children share the same PID namespace and are visible to each other.  If --no-fork  is  used,  the  new
              program will be exec'ed without forking.

Won't this mean the module executed with nsenter is still in the parent PID namespace since we disable forking?"}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-07 20:39:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> PID namespace
 > Children will have a set of PID to process mappings separate from 
 > the  nsenter  process  (CLONE_NEWPID
 > flag).   nsenter  will  fork  by default if changing the PID
 > namespace, so that the new program and its
 > children share the same PID namespace and are visible to each
 > other.  If --no-fork  is  used,  the  new
 > program will be exec'ed without forking.
 > 
 > Won't this mean the module executed with nsenter is still in the
 > parent PID namespace since we disable forking?

Yes this would be true. The parent of the executed program will not be within the container namespace however all subsequent children will be. I have another approach to this issue I worked on last night that essentially retries the action when it encounters and error - https://github.com/cloudnull/openstack-ansible-plugins/commit/a93ee6aa9f88fe7adf4db4621dc823aa076575b7 - I could purse that path if you think it best."}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-07 20:42:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I honestly don't know... but it seems like there could be some strange possibilities presented for modules that deal with processes/pids.. service restarts, etc maybe?"}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-07 20:44:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It seems like maintaining full isolation using the other method might be the best thing.

One other question.. what's the difference between specifying "--no-fork" instead of not passing "'--pid={path}/pid',"'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-07 21:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> It seems like maintaining full isolation using the other method
 > might be the best thing.
 > 
 > One other question.. what's the difference between specifying
 > "--no-fork" instead of not passing "'--pid={path}/pid',"

no-fork will only not fork into the process namespace for the initial application execution. If the application happens to thread or fork itself, all children will be visible within the container. If we happen to not pass in the pid path nothing will be executed within the container process namespace.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-07 21:09:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I honestly don't know... but it seems like there could be some
 > strange possibilities presented for modules that deal with
 > processes/pids.. service restarts, etc maybe?

I'll update this review for the other code path."}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-07 22:27:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also looks like this assert is removed in newer versions of glibc

https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=21386

Interesting.. maybe this issue wont exist on bionic'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-08 00:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-08 04:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-08 05:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-08 06:06:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-09 17:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-09 20:22:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-09 20:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-10 18:35:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-10 22:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-07 05:06:18.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve nsenter fork exception

with the consolidation of container attachment methods we've seen issues
where attaching to a container a container can result in the following
error.

> __libc_fork: Assertion `THREAD_GETMEM (self, tid) != ppid'

This error is caused when two container enter commands are executed at
the exact same time and the OS is not able to accommodate forking a
forked process that forks itself, simultaneously. To correct this
issue the "--no-fork" flag has been added which will ensure we're not
forking unnecessarily.

Change-Id: I97cb3f92ae67b2c5c098c8792a0793972ec0105a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

This error is caused when two container enter commands are executed at

Change-Id: I97cb3f92ae67b2c5c098c8792a0793972ec0105a

'}, {'created': '2018-03-08 06:06:57.000000000', 'message': "Resolve nsenter fork exception

with the consolidation of container attachment methods we've seen issues
where attaching to a container a container can result in the following
error.

> __libc_fork: Assertion `THREAD_GETMEM (self, tid) != ppid'

This error is being caused by a bug in glibc which has been resolved in
2.25+.

* https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=15392

To resolve this issue a retry has been added to the command task which
will look for errors related to the bug and retry when they're
encountered.

Change-Id: I97cb3f92ae67b2c5c098c8792a0793972ec0105a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-03-09 20:22:15.000000000', 'message': "Resolve nsenter fork exception

with the consolidation of container attachment methods we've seen issues
where attaching to a container a container can result in the following
error.

> __libc_fork: Assertion `THREAD_GETMEM (self, tid) != ppid'

This error is being caused by a bug in glibc which has been resolved in
2.25+.

* https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=15392

To resolve this issue the lxc-attach method has been put back when
interacting with lxc type containers. While this issue has been fixed it
is not something we can rely on being fixed in all supported distros at
this time. To resolve this across the board the old lxc-attach command
has been restored to the connection plugin which has worked around the
libc issues internally.

Change-Id: I97cb3f92ae67b2c5c098c8792a0793972ec0105a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve nsenter fork exception

with the consolidation of container attachment methods we've seen issues
where attaching to a container a container can result in the following
error.

> __libc_fork: Assertion `THREAD_GETMEM (self, tid) != ppid'

This error is being caused by a bug in glibc which has been resolved in
2.25+.

* https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=15392

To resolve this issue the lxc-attach method has been put back when
interacting with lxc type containers. While this issue has been fixed it
is not something we can rely on being fixed in all supported distros at
this time. To resolve this across the board the old lxc-attach command
has been restored to the connection plugin which has worked around the
libc issues internally.

Change-Id: I97cb3f92ae67b2c5c098c8792a0793972ec0105a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Re-enable py35 tempest job

The job 'zun-tempest-py35-docker-sql' was temporarily disabled [1]
to unblock the gate. This patch re-enable this job because
the gate issue should be resolved after a tempest plugin fix [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551423/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551690/

Depends-On: Iab8fe32def4590759433404c872a25f050f6a29e
Change-Id: I654cc8959c9a98d37fe9467f18bf374074fa760e

"}, {'created': '2018-03-10 18:26:38.000000000', 'message': "Handle python 2 and 3 compatibility

* Use six.b('') instead of '' for handling the difference
  between string and bytes in python 2 and 3.
* Use six.BytesIO instead of six.StringIO for processing
  data in bytes.

Change-Id: Iab8fe32def4590759433404c872a25f050f6a29e
"}]
commit_message:
Handle python 2 and 3 compatibility

* Use six.b('') instead of '' for handling the difference
  between string and bytes in python 2 and 3.
* Use six.BytesIO instead of six.StringIO for processing
  data in bytes.

Depends-On: I3def3147aedbff56e594f4e7addc80054bd3aaa4
Change-Id: Iab8fe32def4590759433404c872a25f050f6a29e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 12:14:32.000000000', 'message': 'Allow only PTL to merge glance-specs

Glance has had unenforced rule that only PTL should merge specs to
ensure all needed people have had sufficient time to and attention
to review them. This has not been clearly documented and we have
failed to communicate this practise to our new cores. lets enforce
it to avoid any confusions.

Change-Id: I53f2b3353c8420794f617ea333f2defd2550bb74
'}]
commit_message:
Allow only PTL to merge glance-specs

Glance has had unenforced rule that only PTL should merge specs to
ensure all needed people have had sufficient time to and attention
to review them. This has not been clearly documented and we have
failed to communicate this practise to our new cores. lets enforce
it to avoid any confusions.

Change-Id: I53f2b3353c8420794f617ea333f2defd2550bb74

"}, {'created': '2018-03-09 20:05:26.000000000', 'message': "Omit default_schedule_zone if its not configured

There are cases where the default AZ is not called 'nova' in

commit_message:
Omit default_schedule_zone if its not configured

There are cases where the default AZ is not called 'nova' in
a single AZ environment.  This patch adds the default behavior
of Nova by leaving it empty if it's not used.

For deployers that are using it, it will be added so this
should not break them.

Change-Id: Iacaa9785bf7ec7bebe2e0eb69e304bcfab41df5c

commit_message:
freezer: run freezer-scheduler service as root user

freezer-scheduler launch the freezer-agent, that is the process
that does the backup. To performing the operation, this process
needs to be executed as root.

Change-Id: Iccdac65677b29cb9041f82296ad415bc454b8ba4
(cherry picked from commit 60b9218008e1242d2a16bc5c92d200bd6ccdbaa7)

commit_message:
Reduce the number of workers spawned by services

This PS reduces the number of processes spawned by services, as
with Kubernetes load distribution can be better managed by a larger
number of single threaded pods (up to a certain point) and doing so
also provides both increased avilibility, leading to smoother rolling
updates. In addtion when running single replicas resource consuption
is reduced.

Change-Id: Ifb7494a0804913d843a072e10d26c6ec53c3bd16

commit_message:
Prepare for os-client-config wrapper

In order to remove the second copy of the code that is in
os-client-config, we need to be able to set a few class/module names to
allow openstacksdk methods to return the appropriate os-client-config
wrapper subclasses when called via os-client-config.

Also remove a function we had intended to remove back in 2015 that
should not be used by anyone.

Change-Id: Ie279c543fb2142c101f03dcdd45314bbc098ebc4

commit_message:
Redo role assignment list query filters

Unlike all the other keystone filters, role assignment list
uses '.' rather than '_' for some values.

This now fixes that on our end to correctly remap for the
API.

Change-Id: Iaef99c856607a6cfec7c3747366671de4232d232

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Adds toggle port security on network create

Added a new property, 'port_security_enabled' which is a boolean to
enable or disable port_secuirty during network creation. The default
behavior will enable port security, security group and anti spoofing
will act as before. When the attribute is set to False, security
group and anti spoofing are disabled on the ports created on this
network.

Change-Id: If984a82ca5f6fb69ee644f4fa84333df09d7f8bc

[{'created': '2018-03-10 10:24:21.000000000', 'message': "Rework novaclient floating ips actions

Methods for association floating ips and dissociation were deprecated in
novaclient a year ago and latest major release (python-novaclient 10)
doesn't include them[*].
These actions should be performed via neutronclient now. It requires more
work, but there is no other options.

[*] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/remove-virt-interfaces-add-rm-fixed-floating-398c905d9c91cca8.yaml

Change-Id: I6c019fe84fb3d6dfcef5dfadbbccff01bde4a102
"}, {'created': '2018-03-10 10:25:28.000000000', 'message': "Rework novaclient floating ips actions

Methods for association floating ips and dissociation were deprecated in
novaclient a year ago and latest major release (python-novaclient 10)
doesn't include them[*].
These actions should be performed via neutronclient now. It requires more
work, but there is no other options.

As well, we can turn neutron job voting.

[*] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/remove-virt-interfaces-add-rm-fixed-floating-398c905d9c91cca8.yaml

Change-Id: I6c019fe84fb3d6dfcef5dfadbbccff01bde4a102
"}]
commit_message:
Rework novaclient floating ips actions

Methods for association floating ips and dissociation were deprecated in
novaclient a year ago and latest major release (python-novaclient 10)
doesn't include them[*].
These actions should be performed via neutronclient now. It requires more
work, but there is no other options.

As well, we can turn neutron job voting.

[*] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/remove-virt-interfaces-add-rm-fixed-floating-398c905d9c91cca8.yaml

Change-Id: I6c019fe84fb3d6dfcef5dfadbbccff01bde4a102

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: Ib56b7a3a382889f7c1b607b009206cd2c6851d8d

commit_message:
Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info and pin ceph-ansible SHA

1. The OpenStack infrastructure provides us with a list of mirrors
   which are already templated so this will simply the process of
   using those mirrors instead of the previous implementation which
   tries to derive the right URL's.
2. Instead of rewriting the host's sources file for Ubuntu, we leave
   it alone.
3. We place the overrides into a new override file to simplify the
   implementation and no longer require a bunch of conditionals in
   the user_variables template. Some more clean-up can be done, but
   it will follow on later.
4. The ceph-ansible project has created a new library which is held
   in the root folder of the repo. We need to ensure that the library
   path is included, but that results in other breakages. To help
   get patches moving through the system again we pin the SHA to just
   prior the upstream changes.
5. The MariaDB mirror setting has been removed due to the default
   MariaDB setup being done via a specific pin. The apt repo setup
   for MariaDB is no longer being used.

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: Ib908e5503ecc93255d554d027ec62539c6316099

commit_message:
Drop back to Sphinx 1.6.5

Sphinx 1.7.1 is causing build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs for some
projects to return "setup.py: error: argument -o/--output-dir is
required" from under PBR. Temporarily roll back to the 1.6.5 version
we were running before the Queens freeze while we look into it.

This partially reverts commit
505ec718c8a0042e4b8cbeeca534d2038aa3c67d.

Change-Id: I8646f3bc9ba637c6688d3d146e06468b840f1119
Related-Bug: #1753082

commit_message:
tempest plugin and pypi jobs for Mistral tempest plugin

* https://review.openstack.org/531307 adds tempest plugin job
  template, let's use it and then upload the plugin to pypi
  so that dependent projects can consume it

Change-Id: I4872bb6c8329b1a4a8ba787cce6be1b700ebc405

Change-Id: Ib908e5503ecc93255d554d027ec62539c6316099
(cherry picked from commit 90c130575d069ca8ffe850f137e40317c0ad88f1)
"}]
commit_message:
Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info

1. The OpenStack infrastructure provides us with a list of mirrors
   which are already templated so this will simply the process of
   using those mirrors instead of the previous implementation which
   tries to derive the right URL's.
2. Instead of rewriting the host's sources file for Ubuntu, we leave
   it alone.
3. We place the overrides into a new override file to simplify the
   implementation and no longer require a bunch of conditionals in
   the user_variables template. Some more clean-up can be done, but
   it will follow on later.
5. The MariaDB mirror setting has been removed due to the default
   MariaDB setup being done via a specific pin. The apt repo setup
   for MariaDB is no longer being used.

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/install_packages.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: Ib908e5503ecc93255d554d027ec62539c6316099
(cherry picked from commit 90c130575d069ca8ffe850f137e40317c0ad88f1)

commit_message:
Collect ansible_dir for undercloud containers

The undercloud containers job creates the ansible files and inventory at
$HOME/tripleo-*-config. Collect these files in our CI job results as
they are very useful to help troubleshoot.

Change-Id: Ie6cc65775efe63ec8d58eca0716fc5b8f7bbfefc

commit_message:
Modify huawei switch configuration

1.Huawei switch does'n not solve the action of deleting port.
So it will lead to safety issues.
2. Add some configuration for Huawei PLUG_PORT_TO_NETWORK to ensure
interface access vlan.

Change-Id: Iba42ea92b831c55746165dd4fdf8c585b81a9901
Closes-Bug: #1753421

commit_message:
Register traits on nodes in devstack

This change adds support for assiging traits to nodes in the ironic
devstack plugin.  The set of traits added is configured by
IRONIC_DEFAULT_TRAITS, which defaults to a single trait - CUSTOM_GOLD

Using nodes with traits during testing ensures that we are exercising
node traits code paths in the Ironic CI.

Node traits are not used for upgrade testing, as the queens devstack
plugin does not currently register traits. Once this change is
backported to queens, we can enable traits during upgrade testing.

Change-Id: I18b9dbf8a5b16e36e0cc14f290b12ffdd634364a
Related-Bug: #1722194
Related-Bug: #1750027

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-08 16:07:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes certificate generation error for Neutron agents

TLS certificates were introduced for the Neutron Base service in order
for Neutron to securely communicate with OVS via SSL/TLS.  However, the
implementation only required Neutron DHCP agent (ODL deployment) to use
the certificates.  The other OVS agents are not used in ODL deployments
and SSL/TLS use there may be added in the future.  However, since other
services inherit NeutronBase config_settings, they will attempt to
generate certs.  This certificate generation will fail because these
services do not inherit metadata settings.

This patch fixes the above issue by adding the metadata settings
inheritance to every service derived from NeutronBase.

Closes-Bug: 1754363

Change-Id: I87afc3a11efeefc1cfd768dfe817fbb3b2422694
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes certificate generation error for Neutron agents

TLS certificates were introduced for the Neutron Base service in order
for Neutron to securely communicate with OVS via SSL/TLS.  However, the
implementation only required Neutron DHCP agent (ODL deployment) to use
the certificates.  The other OVS agents are not used in ODL deployments
and SSL/TLS use there may be added in the future.  However, since other
services inherit NeutronBase config_settings, they will attempt to
generate certs.  This certificate generation will fail because these
services do not inherit metadata settings.

This patch fixes the above issue by adding the metadata settings
inheritance to every service derived from NeutronBase.

Closes-Bug: 1754363

Change-Id: I87afc3a11efeefc1cfd768dfe817fbb3b2422694
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
`bind_host` and `bind_port` are coming under `api_setting

Option 'bind_host' from group 'DEFAULT' is deprecated for removal[0],
please use option 'bind_host' from group 'api_settings' instead. bind_port
option are the same.
The default value of api_handler is queue_producer, we did not configure
it. So delete api_handler option.

[0]https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/common/config.py#L45

Change-Id: I4e9c1d40bcb497f147ea38d4f3c6d78c181fa20b
Closes-Bug: #1717190

commit_message:
add parameter to overwrite/add wsgi process options

Add parameter to apache_wsgi to allow overwrite
and/or add additional wsgi process options.

This possibility was added to openstacklib
with Change-Id: I41914ce3361988d5db1695f09d21209772fdf548
lease enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting

Change-Id: Ibb04420a730bb0fdccc30fe6e81d4b0f5fc6ebc2

[{'created': '2018-01-10 03:42:43.000000000', 'message': 'Remove /lib/udev in $PATH for nova-compute

Add /lib/udev environment variable[1] is to solve the scsi_id access
problems, but the patch[2][3] pointed out the absolute path scsi_id,
we can not add /lib/udev environment variables in the system for
nova-compute. So we can remove /lib/udev in $PATH for nova-compute.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291285/
[2]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277224/
[3]https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py#L147

Change-Id: I5326edf8fff5745ef119c0c3decd6f4c51e8bd5d
Closes-Bug: #1742340
'}]
commit_message:
Remove /lib/udev in $PATH for nova-compute

Add /lib/udev environment variable[1] is to solve the scsi_id access
problems, but the patch[2][3] pointed out the absolute path scsi_id,
we can not add /lib/udev environment variables in the system for
nova-compute. So we can remove /lib/udev in $PATH for nova-compute.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291285/
[2]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277224/
[3]https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py#L147

Change-Id: I5326edf8fff5745ef119c0c3decd6f4c51e8bd5d
Closes-Bug: #1742340

commit_message:
Add kombu_failover_strategy option

Adds the kombu_failover_strategy option for configuring
oslo.messaging.rabbit. This will determines how the next RabbitMQ node
is chosen in case the one we are currently connected to becomes
unavailable.

Change-Id: Ia08af6da0976697d65bcc1b55b857b0f4a5742bc
Closes-Bug: #1748353

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-27 14:17:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test_limits_rbac not checking for expected response

This is to fix test_show_limits test under test_limits_rbac
in volume module which is currently expecting a fatal exception
to be raised by the Cinder server following failed authorization.
However, this assumption is false because this endpoint uses
non-fatal authorization [0] to inject additional attributes into
the response body following successfuly authorization.

Thus, it is necessary Patrole side to verify that the expected
attributes are present in the response body, as expecting a 403
is a false assumption.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/67177026ab510b09644fd4b8b301594aa5482cef/cinder/api/contrib/used_limits.py#L30

Change-Id: I3aae5d8c6c947cf5119f1cdc081dae8179421564
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_limits_rbac not checking for expected response

This is to fix test_show_limits test under test_limits_rbac
in volume module which is currently expecting a fatal exception
to be raised by the Cinder server following failed authorization.
However, this assumption is false because this endpoint uses
non-fatal authorization [0] to inject additional attributes into
the response body following successfuly authorization.

Thus, it is necessary Patrole side to verify that the expected
attributes are present in the response body, as expecting a 403
is a false assumption.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/67177026ab510b09644fd4b8b301594aa5482cef/cinder/api/contrib/used_limits.py#L30

Change-Id: I3aae5d8c6c947cf5119f1cdc081dae8179421564

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 11:27:42.000000000', 'message': "Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info

1. The OpenStack infrastructure provides us with a list of mirrors
   which are already templated so this will simply the process of
   using those mirrors instead of the previous implementation which
   tries to derive the right URL's.
2. Instead of rewriting the host's sources file for Ubuntu, we leave
   it alone.
3. We place the overrides into a new override file to simplify the
   implementation and no longer require a bunch of conditionals in
   the user_variables template. Some more clean-up can be done, but
   it will follow on later.
5. The MariaDB mirror setting has been removed due to the default
   MariaDB setup being done via a specific pin. The apt repo setup
   for MariaDB is no longer being used.

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/install_packages.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: Ib908e5503ecc93255d554d027ec62539c6316099
(cherry picked from commit 90c130575d069ca8ffe850f137e40317c0ad88f1)

commit_message:
Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info

1. The OpenStack infrastructure provides us with a list of mirrors
   which are already templated so this will simplify the process of
   using those mirrors instead of the previous implementation which
   tries to derive the right URL's.
2. Instead of rewriting the host's sources file for Ubuntu, we leave
   it alone.
3. We place the overrides into a new override file to simplify the
   implementation and no longer require a bunch of conditionals in
   the user_variables template. Some more clean-up can be done, but
   it will follow on later.
5. The MariaDB mirror setting has been removed due to the default
   MariaDB setup being done via a specific pin. The apt repo setup
   for MariaDB is no longer being used.

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/install_packages.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: Ib908e5503ecc93255d554d027ec62539c6316099
(cherry picked from commit 90c130575d069ca8ffe850f137e40317c0ad88f1)

commit_message:
undercloud_post: override stackrc

When upgrading to a containerized undercloud, the stackrc needs to be
overriden so we don't rely on hiera CLI anymore to get the admin
password.

Change-Id: Ie2579bf83d709838557c56d952e61656b84acf31

commit_message:
Api-ref:Add target volume preconditions for backup restore.

the status of volume must be available.
the size of the volume must be equal to or greater than
the backup size.

Change-Id: I89bb72741aec5e73789a5a5cec1bc363f79c766c

commit_message:
Revert "Drop back to docker 2.7.0"

This reverts commit ce771ed96970856ab3d04774510d4e3ffb689b44.

The problems with Docker 3.1.0 version has been solved [1][2], also checked the solution in both local and gate environments [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549724/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550400/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551179/

Change-Id: I1754c45b41522142a9621753ef2ffab7cd6143cd

subject: Add RBAC test for show_encryption_specs_item
messages: [{'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-02-25 14:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17896, 'date': '2018-02-26 14:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-03-09 23:33:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-25 14:14:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add RBAC test for show_encryption_specs_item

This adds an RBAC test for volume v3 client endpoint
show_encryption_specs_item. This was recently added to Tempest
in [0]. The policy it enforces is
"volume_extension:volume_type_encryption" [1] and it is enforced
in code here [2].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521241/

commit_message:
Add RBAC test for show_encryption_specs_item

This adds an RBAC test for volume v3 client endpoint
show_encryption_specs_item. This was recently added to Tempest
in [0]. The policy it enforces is
"volume_extension:volume_type_encryption" [1] and it is enforced
in code here [2].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521241/
[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/e75d209177b8b65f28429e64e79b4101dbcf58b3/cinder/policies/volume_type.py#L65
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/e75d209177b8b65f28429e64e79b4101dbcf58b3/cinder/api/contrib/volume_type_encryption.py#L147

Change-Id: I8518bee5720956eb6c3c280e311458991ff30325

commit_message:
3PAR: Add `force detach` support

Add support to force detach a volume from all hosts on 3PAR.

Change-Id: I2ddd0be0d59018db43dca297585d5cb2ee459ede
Closes-bug: #1686745
(cherry picked from commit abca1abc7b01fc1d85af8b9cfa5b646abafc9d4a)

subject: Align parsed() call with cmd2 versions >= 0.7.3
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 11805, 'name': 'Corey Bryant', 'email': 'corey.bryant@canonical.com', 'username': 'coreycb'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27888, 'name': 'Lucas Meneghel Rodrigues', 'email': 'lookkas@gmail.com', 'username': 'lmr'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-02-28 15:53:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-02-28 15:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit b7a8e854ec638432651e7837f613dc0fd5ac81df'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-02-28 18:53:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Don't you love it when maintainers follow deprecations and are careful with (re)moving things ...

Does the new version work with cmd2==0.6.7 though, which is the current lower bound, or do we need to increase that?"}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-02-28 19:10:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Good catch and thanks for reviewing. I don't think the current patch will work with 0.6.7. I could do the following:

try:
    self.parsed
except AttributeError:
    self.parser_manager.parsed"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-02-28 19:56:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Actually for master the requirements just got bumped, I was looking at a stale version earlier. So the patch here would be good as it stands, see Ie5e5a809dd94cb1d996d8c093ee01ca9b503dc99

But probably we'll need a modified version for the stable branches.

Also might be nice to have a test for this to avoid another regression, but I wouldn't block the fix for that."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-02-28 20:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-02-28 20:16:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-02-28 20:19:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ok. This version remains the same now that master branch of global-requirements has cmd2 >= 8.0.0. however I've updated the backported versions to have the try/except logic."}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-03-02 16:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-03-02 16:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Is this patch conflicted with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548625/ ?'}, {'account_id': 27888, 'date': '2018-03-05 16:08:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Is this patch conflicted with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548625/
 > ?

Yes it does. I looked at this change, and the solution employed here is better. Just make sure it handles the older versions of cmd2 and I'd be happy to drop my change.

Another 

In the end what I want is to have the next release of cliff to have a functional interactive shell.

 > Is this patch conflicted with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548625/
 > ?

Yes, the changes conflict. This change has the better solution. Let's just make sure this handles both new and old versions of cmd2, and I'll be happy to drop my change. In the end, I just want to have the new release of cliff to have a working interactive shell."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-03-05 16:18:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi, I can't tell what conflicting patch is being discussed above.

In terms of handling old versions of cmd2, I've done that in the backported stable branch patches however for master global-requirements has cmd2 >= 8.0.0 so I don't know if it's necessary."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-03-05 16:18:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

If it's necessary, I can add it back."}, {'account_id': 27888, 'date': '2018-03-05 18:27:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Hi, I can't tell what conflicting patch is being discussed above.
 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548397/
 
 > In terms of handling old versions of cmd2, I've done that in the
 > backported stable branch patches however for master
 > global-requirements has cmd2 >= 8.0.0 so I don't know if it's
 > necessary."}, {'account_id': 27888, 'date': '2018-03-05 18:40:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

My patch is:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548397/

 > If it's necessary, I can add it back.

Since dependencies are correctly handled in both master and stable branches, there's no need to bring it back. If interactive shell works on cliff installed by pip ('pip install cliff') moving forward, then it's all fine by me.

I sent my patch with the sole purpose of getting my own itch scratched, since I started working on a cliff app a couple months ago, and I was being hit by LP 1751822's root cause. Having the interactive shell in working order is all I care about."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-06 13:41:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

> If it's necessary, I can add it back.

Unfortunately, I think it will be.

The patch to update the cmd2 dependency for cliff to 0.8.0 is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548672/2. If we land that, we know we will break things as they stand now. If you update this patch to allow for both versions of cmd2, then we can land your patch and follow up by landing the requirements bump without having anything broken.

Thanks for working on this. BTW, if any of you are interested in updating cliff to remove the cmd2 dependency, I would support that work with reviews. This isn't the first time cmd2 has caused us trouble, and it's not really clear to me any more what features I thought we would get by incorporating it."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-03-06 14:27:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Not a problem, I'll resubmit.

Just to pile on, I had frustrations with pyperclip recently, which is a dependency of cmd2. I've had an outstanding PR sitting there for several months and the project doesn't appear to be maintained very well. To cmd2's credit, the maintainer is active and responsive."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-03-06 14:32:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-06 15:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

> Not a problem, I'll resubmit.
 > 
 > Just to pile on, I had frustrations with pyperclip recently, which
 > is a dependency of cmd2. I've had an outstanding PR sitting there
 > for several months and the project doesn't appear to be maintained
 > very well. To cmd2's credit, the maintainer is active and
 > responsive.

Oh, yeah, Catherine has been pretty good about responding to issues when we've brought them up, especially lately. I just used cmd2 because "cmd2 must be more better than cmd" though, so if we can have the same basic feature set without it and avoid future issues, maybe it's worth dropping the dependency.

Thanks for providing the fix, in any case.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-06 15:07:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-03-06 15:10:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-03-06 15:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-06 16:49:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-03-09 19:15:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Align parsed() call with cmd2 versions >= 0.7.3

In version 0.7.3, cmd2 moved the parsed method from class Cmd()
to class ParserManager().

Change-Id: Ie0c057ffaeaa05c4f5e0f3599aab850245c55066
Closes-Bug: #1751822

commit_message:
Fix swift.cli.find_shard_ranges script

... and install it via setup.py.

At some point, we may want to rethink the __repr__ for OuterBounds; this
manifested as

   TypeError: '' is not JSON serializable

which feels kinda stupid.

Change-Id: I70142feeedaaafa5da4a2845f8a688c6a2045c2b
Related-Change: I8cf5d72a9256ee2bae141ebdb892db2cb578f39a

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Updates boot mode on the baremetal as per `boot_mode`

This patch modifies the ilo drivers to use the
`boot_mode` capability for cleaning and update the
same on the baremetal.

Change-Id: I5b095cac47890e117866f0569f69148deff173b7
Closes-Bug: #1559835

[{'created': '2018-03-07 20:46:59.000000000', 'message': "Do not start conntrack worker thread from __init__

Instead, start it when the first entry is being added to
the queue.  Also, log any exceptions just in case get()
throws something so we can do further debugging.

Changed class from Queue to LightQueue was done after going
through the eventlet.queue code looking at usage, since
it's a little smaller and should be faster.

Change-Id: Ie84be88382f327ebe312bf17ec2dc5c80a8de35f
Closes-bug: 1750777
(cherry picked from commit 4c8b97eca32c9c2beadf95fef14ed5b7d8981c5a)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not start conntrack worker thread from __init__

Instead, start it when the first entry is being added to
the queue.  Also, log any exceptions just in case get()
throws something so we can do further debugging.

Changed class from Queue to LightQueue was done after going
through the eventlet.queue code looking at usage, since
it's a little smaller and should be faster.

Change-Id: Ie84be88382f327ebe312bf17ec2dc5c80a8de35f
Closes-bug: 1750777
(cherry picked from commit 4c8b97eca32c9c2beadf95fef14ed5b7d8981c5a)

commit_message:
Added vendor_data.json support

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to add vendor_data.json
for deployments.  It can make things configurable via a simple
dictionary.

Change-Id: If5b061776120c3d7a7ff763eb2757c0b5b184000

commit_message:
Add another path for service files

In opensuse the service files are located in /usr/lib rather than /lib. This change adds this path
as an option.

Change-Id: I99c2db557a2290c3860bb41233d7efc35d03be0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 18:53:16.000000000', 'message': "[wip] Rework novaclient floating ips actions

Methods for association floating ips and dissociation were deprecated in
novaclient a year ago and latest major release (python-novaclient 10)
doesn't include them[*].
These actions should be performed via neutronclient now. It requires more
work, but there is no other options.

[*] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/remove-virt-interfaces-add-rm-fixed-floating-398c905d9c91cca8.yaml

Change-Id: I6c019fe84fb3d6dfcef5dfadbbccff01bde4a102

commit_message:
Rework novaclient floating ips actions

Methods for association floating ips and dissociation were deprecated in
novaclient a year ago and latest major release (python-novaclient 10)
doesn't include them[*].
These actions should be performed via neutronclient now. It requires more
work, but there is no other options.

[*] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/remove-virt-interfaces-add-rm-fixed-floating-398c905d9c91cca8.yaml

Change-Id: I6c019fe84fb3d6dfcef5dfadbbccff01bde4a102

subject: Fix non working repo upgrade command for ffu.
messages:
[{'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-03-07 14:01:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-08 00:41:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It failed for me with the following error:

TASK [tripleo-upgrade : create 11 undercloud upgrade script] *******************
\x1b[0;31mfatal: [undercloud-0]: FAILED! => {"msg": "The field 'vars' has an invalid value, which includes an undefined variable. The error was: 'dict object' has no attribute u'11'\n\nThe error appears to have been in '/home/rhos-ci/jenkins/workspace/upgrade-10-11-12-13-3ctrl-1comp/infrared/plugins/tripleo-upgrade/tasks/fast-forward-upgrade/create-ffu-scripts.yaml': line 1, column 3, but may\nbe elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.\n\nThe offending line appears to be:\n\n\n- name: create {{ release }} undercloud upgrade script\n  ^ here\nWe could be wrong, but this one looks like it might be an issue with\nmissing quotes.  Always quote template expression brackets when they\nstart a value. For instance:\n\n    with_items:\n      - {{ foo }}\n\nShould be written as:\n\n    with_items:\n      - \"{{ foo }}\"\n\nexception type: <class 'ansible.errors.AnsibleUndefinedVariable'>\nexception: 'dict object' has no attribute u'11'"}\x1b[0m'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-03-08 16:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-08 18:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-09 08:20:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-03-09 16:36:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-09 20:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 52efe4b5eb135c92b0b6d06147e9219d7aa2a7da'}]

Use the same refactor here to simplify the cmd_args assignement.

Change-Id: I53829f8c4461a648553328a92d7b379d8904da95
Related-Bug: #1749911
"}, {'created': '2018-03-08 16:38:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix non working repo upgrade command for ffu.

commit_message:
Fix non working repo upgrade command for ffu.

As seen in the related bug, assigning dependent variable in the _vars_
section of Ansible isn't reliable as it's an hash.

Use the same refactor here to simplify the cmd_args assignement.

Change-Id: I53829f8c4461a648553328a92d7b379d8904da95
Related-Bug: #1749911

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-21 09:36:57.000000000', 'message': 'LVM: Activate thin snapshot before clone activation

LVM may be configured to not automatically activate
thin-provisioned LVs. Ensure they are activated before
activating a clone, otherwise activating the clone may fail.

Change-Id: Iaedeb3cdc706daa34db8d50c48cf738f6edb9bcf
Related-Bug: #1642111

commit_message:
LVM: Activate thin snapshot before clone activation

LVM may be configured to not automatically activate
thin-provisioned LVs. Ensure they are activated before
activating a clone, otherwise activating the clone may fail.

Change-Id: Iaedeb3cdc706daa34db8d50c48cf738f6edb9bcf
Related-Bug: #1642111
(cherry picked from commit 17c447e9f06af0afb195d6a2879c06233de520c7)

commit_message:
Change numeric constants to VARIABLE_NAME

There was usage of things like: return 0xd5

Change it to: return IPMI_COMMAND_NOT_SUPPORTED

Also give a pointer to the IPMI specification.

Change-Id: I7dbbe593fbf7f49aa5151bbff1678db63b5f172c

commit_message:
Remove devices/*/boot when setting bootdev

"boot" entries under "devices/*" are mutually exclusive with those
under "os". If such entries are present, vbmc fails when adding "boot"
entry under "os".

Closes-Bug: #1746983
Change-Id: I357d3b8a92ee764e6f47f564fdef54d3a79f0782

commit_message:
Ignore artifacts of tox docs build

Running tox -e docs generates extra .rst files under doc/source/ which
are not tracked in git, so add them to .gitignore.

Change-Id: Ic6f6f8ff3bb2e87c412f84532e74b821a0518367

commit_message:
Modifications to candidacy submission rules

* Change candidacy filenames from IRC nick to email address
* Assert that candidates must self-nominate, but others may commit to gerrit
* Indcate that IRC nick will be collected from the Foundation Member profile

Change-Id: I4393c30265cd5b6cb7667b14ef2ef4b15b774533

commit_message:
Move in playbook and variables

The os_ceilometer role is being transitioned out of the OSA integrated repo.
This commit moves the playbooks and variables related to ceilometer
from the integrated repo into the role repository under the 'extras'
directory.

Change-Id: Ib8f4a010833044ebedd6ec2435d14896aee3ecd8
Depends-On: I7bfa5d1a786ab68560783d7ac662fec6c7848c93

The os_gnocchi role is being transitioned out of the OSA integrated repo.

from the integrated repo into the role repository under the 'extras'
directory.

commit_message:
Make shard-info annotate lines with node index

Before, each line was annotated with the node id. Now each
line is annotated with the node index which aids identifying the
leader node.

Also add an entry for actual object count as well as apparent object
count. When a container is sharded the actual object count will be
misplaced objects whereas the apparent object count is the sum of
object counts reported from shard containers.

Change-Id: I8736590376a5f82348f8358448b724085820c761

guard code was missing.

commit_message:
Update upper-constraints consumption

In order to deal with neutron going into the upper-constraints file so
that neutron plugins can consume it normally, we need to align the
constraints invocation in neutron's tox.ini. This means putting the -C
argument into the dependencies list rather than the pip install line so
that it doesn't get appended to tox installing neutron itself.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/550475
Change-Id: I014177c8afcadd3e6acb20bd38bb9d9fcc778ed6

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I274313eb93a0a4a6b2c43381d0c9d0073620d668

subject: Fix stack update with rabbitmq containers
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-03-08 08:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-03-09 08:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\ncan we please wait for queens to actually merge!'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-03-09 16:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-08 08:02:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix stack update with rabbitmq containers

In change I44865af3d5eb2d37eb648ac7227277e86c8fbc54 we
add support to change rabbitmq password on update.
This breaks when using containers in a number of scenarios:
- FFU because at this stage rabbitmq can be down on the node
  and the call to rabbitmq_user will trigger a rabbitmqctl list_user
  call which will eventually time out.
- Controller replacement procedure because on the newly replaced
  controller rabbitmq will not be up yet and the rabbitmq_user call
  will timeout just like during FFU.
- Upgrades from Pike to Queens upgrades we seem to be hitting the
  same issue as FFU

The exact error that we will get on the non bootstrap nodes is the
following:
=ERROR REPORT==== 3-Mar-2018::05:37:39 ===** Connection attempt from
disallowed node 'rabbitmq-cli-67@controller-1' **

The reason for this is that on non bootstrap node we do not enforce
the Exec['rabbitmq-ready'] -> Rabbitmq_user<||> collector, because
we do not want to enforce it there (think controller replacement)

Let's make sure we enforce the Rabbitmq_user class only on bootstrap
nodes, since in HA deployments the users get replicated by the cluster anyway.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1753949

Change-Id: I483fe61f09fa2c3034d2b3d8ffa1ca53feefe6af
(cherry picked from commit 2abe91fe867fa18b6181324a083f4a33b60066e8)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix stack update with rabbitmq containers

In change I44865af3d5eb2d37eb648ac7227277e86c8fbc54 we
add support to change rabbitmq password on update.
This breaks when using containers in a number of scenarios:
- FFU because at this stage rabbitmq can be down on the node
  and the call to rabbitmq_user will trigger a rabbitmqctl list_user
  call which will eventually time out.
- Controller replacement procedure because on the newly replaced
  controller rabbitmq will not be up yet and the rabbitmq_user call
  will timeout just like during FFU.
- Upgrades from Pike to Queens upgrades we seem to be hitting the
  same issue as FFU

The exact error that we will get on the non bootstrap nodes is the
following:
=ERROR REPORT==== 3-Mar-2018::05:37:39 ===** Connection attempt from
disallowed node 'rabbitmq-cli-67@controller-1' **

The reason for this is that on non bootstrap node we do not enforce
the Exec['rabbitmq-ready'] -> Rabbitmq_user<||> collector, because
we do not want to enforce it there (think controller replacement)

Let's make sure we enforce the Rabbitmq_user class only on bootstrap
nodes, since in HA deployments the users get replicated by the cluster anyway.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1753949

Change-Id: I483fe61f09fa2c3034d2b3d8ffa1ca53feefe6af
(cherry picked from commit 2abe91fe867fa18b6181324a083f4a33b60066e8)

The repo configured for MariaDB that uses HTTPS. This prevents the
repo server from caching the MariaDB packages. That causes significant
delays during CentOS 7 deployments/gates since those packages are quite
large.

This is a combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/546309

Closes-Bug: 1750665

commit_message:
Allow Galera package downloads over HTTP

The repo configured for MariaDB that uses HTTPS. This prevents the
repo server from caching the MariaDB packages. That causes significant
delays during CentOS 7 deployments/gates since those packages are quite
large.

This is a combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/546309
- https://review.openstack.org/549171

Closes-Bug: 1750665
Change-Id: I2192ade6eb204404fe67d47af063e0e57fbe7d62

install directly and add constraints to dependencies.

commit_message:
Only delete and re-create managed Mistral workflows

In Pike Mistral workflows in tripleo-common were tagged with
`tripleo-common-managed`. During the transition we needed to conder
installs with no tagged workflows. However, users of Queens and above
will already have this handled, so the extra code and the test case can
be removed.

Change-Id: I06b3bccf03c1e2851c0bc3b291cefbf24ff7dbff

commit_message:
Add kombu_failover_strategy option

Adds the kombu_failover_strategy option for configuring
oslo.messaging.rabbit. This will determines how the next RabbitMQ node
is chosen in case the one we are currently connected to becomes
unavailable.

Change-Id: Id360da722f4bacab3835ab8b48d4de95df700736
Closes-Bug: #1748353
(cherry picked from commit 5e12d373339c76b9c0c0e24d854770693a999b1d)

commit_message:
Add some kombu options

Adds the kombu_failover_strategy option for configuring
oslo.messaging.rabbit. This will determines how the next RabbitMQ node
is chosen in case the one we are currently connected to becomes
unavailable.

Change-Id: Ieb0b4c62e8e7b00b4f73ca793298fbf052b6fdb9
Closes-Bug: #1748353
(cherry picked from commit a5b9a060eb57d9fd345b33c90d43205e9814e8f3)

commit_message:
Drop Django <= 1.10 support

After Django 2.0 support, we no longer supports Django 1.10 or older
(Actually Django 1.10 seems to work though).
The current django.VERSION branches are all related to Django 1.10
or older, so we can drop all conditions.

py35dj20 job is now voting.

blueprint django2-support
Change-Id: Iefc0ab1c62c82f2842ec7761a9b981da9351cbd2

commit_message:
Add some kombu options

Adds the kombu_failover_strategy option for configuring
oslo.messaging.rabbit. This will determines how the next RabbitMQ node
is chosen in case the one we are currently connected to becomes
unavailable.

Change-Id: I027e9f4da58e290065ae048800d358114b69b63f
Closes-Bug: #1748353
(cherry picked from commit 6362185f5c93c67fdaedd1ef94a6b776e4adbbc6)

commit_message:
Add throughput limits that scale per-GB

This allows new values in QoS specs:
 - read_bytes_sec_per_gb
 - write_bytes_sec_per_gb
 - total_bytes_sec_per_gb

The bytes value specifed in the QoS spec is multiplied
by the size of the volume in initialize_connection,
and the result is passed along like a standard <x>_bytes_sec
QoS value.

Change-Id: Iafc22d37c4c50515d9f6cf1144ea25847c90f75d
(cherry picked from commit 29d2090aef7b31df23ca846d365c6d21957486ba)

commit_message:
Add throughput limits that scale per-GB

This allows new values in QoS specs:
 - read_bytes_sec_per_gb
 - write_bytes_sec_per_gb
 - total_bytes_sec_per_gb

The bytes value specifed in the QoS spec is multiplied
by the size of the volume in initialize_connection,
and the result is passed along like a standard <x>_bytes_sec
QoS value.

Change-Id: Iafc22d37c4c50515d9f6cf1144ea25847c90f75d
(cherry picked from commit 29d2090aef7b31df23ca846d365c6d21957486ba)

commit_message:
Do not start conntrack worker thread from __init__

Instead, start it when the first entry is being added to
the queue.  Also, log any exceptions just in case get()
throws something so we can do further debugging.

Changed class from Queue to LightQueue was done after going
through the eventlet.queue code looking at usage, since
it's a little smaller and should be faster.

Change-Id: Ie84be88382f327ebe312bf17ec2dc5c80a8de35f
Closes-bug: 1750777
