commit_message:
Add kombu_failover_strategy option

Adds the kombu_failover_strategy option for configuring
oslo.messaging.rabbit. This will determines how the next RabbitMQ node
is chosen in case the one we are currently connected to becomes
unavailable.

Change-Id: I904e0bb50c12f94a21ad006c3435d94f0104ecf8
Closes-Bug: #1748353
(cherry picked from commit 46b60d02fac0f2c4742c447fc560a7e59a97a208)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-08 14:53:14.000000000', 'message': 'Allow Galera package downloads over HTTP

The repo configured for MariaDB that uses HTTPS. This prevents the
repo server from caching the MariaDB packages. That causes significant
delays during CentOS 7 deployments/gates since those packages are quite
large.

This is a combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/546308
- https://review.openstack.org/549172

Closes-Bug: 1750665
Change-Id: I2071b0690778669a81770630f25c3dbfa567c818
'}]
commit_message:
Allow Galera package downloads over HTTP

The repo configured for MariaDB that uses HTTPS. This prevents the
repo server from caching the MariaDB packages. That causes significant
delays during CentOS 7 deployments/gates since those packages are quite
large.

This is a combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/546308
- https://review.openstack.org/549172

Closes-Bug: 1750665
Change-Id: I2071b0690778669a81770630f25c3dbfa567c818

commit_message:
Django2: Use new custom template loader interface

The new template loader interface is described here:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/ref/templates/api/#loader-methods

The old interface was deprecated in Django 1.9, and the old interface
load_template_sources() was removed in Django 2.0.
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.9/#template-loader-apis-have-changed

According to the UT result, force_escape in _detail_overview.html
looks unnecessary. If force_escape is used, the returned string will
be double-escaped and it is not what we expect.

blueprint django2-support
Change-Id: I8a5a79cb61a6ebd25453bde3e0ec64f5b5f50e1b

commit_message:
Reorganize docs to fit openstackdocstheme

After switching to openstackdocstheme, the left side menu lists
all specs and it is no longer useful as navigation.
This commit reorganizes the doc structure and toctree so that
the toctree is easy to read with openstackdocstheme.

Change-Id: I47a8c28c038bf2022855a81f6073f4b5f4b01266

commit_message:
Add kombu_failover_strategy option

Adds the kombu_failover_strategy option for configuring
oslo.messaging.rabbit. This will determines how the next RabbitMQ node
is chosen in case the one we are currently connected to becomes
unavailable.

Change-Id: I2ec87a9649143548847c46110ef1ad9353a71feb
Closes-Bug: #1748353
(cherry picked from commit dd721c2e252a5e9464aa17169b859045fdb199e8)

subject: Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-09 11:11:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-09 11:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-09 13:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-09 14:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 11:11:28.000000000', 'message': "Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info

1. The OpenStack infrastructure provides us with a list of mirrors
   which are already templated so this will simply the process of
   using those mirrors instead of the previous implementation which
   tries to derive the right URL's.
2. Instead of rewriting the host's sources file for Ubuntu, we leave
   it alone.
3. We place the overrides into a new override file to simplify the
   implementation and no longer require a bunch of conditionals in
   the user_variables template. Some more clean-up can be done, but
   it will follow on later.
5. The MariaDB mirror setting has been removed due to the default
   MariaDB setup being done via a specific pin. The apt repo setup
   for MariaDB is no longer being used.

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/install_packages.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: Ib908e5503ecc93255d554d027ec62539c6316099
(cherry picked from commit 90c130575d069ca8ffe850f137e40317c0ad88f1)
"}, {'created': '2018-03-09 11:28:55.000000000', 'message': "Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info

1. The OpenStack infrastructure provides us with a list of mirrors
   which are already templated so this will simply the process of
   using those mirrors instead of the previous implementation which
   tries to derive the right URL's.
2. Instead of rewriting the host's sources file for Ubuntu, we leave
   it alone.
3. We place the overrides into a new override file to simplify the
   implementation and no longer require a bunch of conditionals in
   the user_variables template. Some more clean-up can be done, but
   it will follow on later.
5. The MariaDB mirror setting has been removed due to the default
   MariaDB setup being done via a specific pin. The apt repo setup
   for MariaDB is no longer being used.

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/install_packages.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: Ib908e5503ecc93255d554d027ec62539c6316099
(cherry picked from commit 90c130575d069ca8ffe850f137e40317c0ad88f1)
"}]
commit_message:
Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info

1. The OpenStack infrastructure provides us with a list of mirrors
   which are already templated so this will simply the process of
   using those mirrors instead of the previous implementation which
   tries to derive the right URL's.
2. Instead of rewriting the host's sources file for Ubuntu, we leave
   it alone.
3. We place the overrides into a new override file to simplify the
   implementation and no longer require a bunch of conditionals in
   the user_variables template. Some more clean-up can be done, but
   it will follow on later.
5. The MariaDB mirror setting has been removed due to the default
   MariaDB setup being done via a specific pin. The apt repo setup
   for MariaDB is no longer being used.

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/install_packages.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: Ib908e5503ecc93255d554d027ec62539c6316099
(cherry picked from commit 90c130575d069ca8ffe850f137e40317c0ad88f1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 09:39:18.000000000', 'message': 'Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I93a81708db30ab32bc7507d0cea04845e335acf3
'}]
commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I93a81708db30ab32bc7507d0cea04845e335acf3

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
django2: adopt New-style middleware

Django 1.10 introduces a new style of middleware and
the old style was removed in Django 2.0.

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#new-style-middleware

blueprint django2-support
Change-Id: I2fba2b1b2b528096422df3ed558ad75a1b80bbb9

commit_message:
Adds FFU developer docs base - workflow and tripleo-heat-templates

Adds a base for developer docs for the fast forward upgrade.
This includes a workflow overview and some details about the way
we generate the fast_forward_upgrade_playbook.yaml from
tripleo-heat-templates

spec @ https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-specs/blob/master/specs/queens/fast-forward-upgrades.rst
Change-Id: I11dcebe7e9eba21b0380d476f86e82b9876ca5bd

commit_message:
Use the stable/queens branch for dependencies

After the cut of a bifrost stable branch, it is necessary to modify the
default branch used to install dependencies to stable/queens. We also
use the queens tinyipa ramdisk and kernel image artifacts.

Change-Id: I284ea5456e556ddbb7c14900b22e86313138f42e

commit_message:
Prometheus: tidy rbac roles and bindings to live with appropriate rc

This PS brings Prometheus (& associated charts) inline with other charts
by placing the RBAC roles and bindings in the same template as the
pod rc they are assocated with.

Change-Id: Ib4e477ce864e0f70f9e28f20c2fd0692fd80c4f2

[{'created': '2018-02-27 06:33:14.000000000', 'message': "Delete redundant code

disk_format is checked by 'image_utils.validate_disk_format', so
disk_format will not be 'parallels' in any case.

Change-Id: I6dd7199cf3978aa7f5825d01436245f4f53b5f9b
"}]
commit_message:
Delete redundant code

disk_format is checked by 'image_utils.validate_disk_format', so
disk_format will not be 'parallels' in any case.

Change-Id: I6dd7199cf3978aa7f5825d01436245f4f53b5f9b

[{'created': '2018-03-07 17:04:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix allocated_capacity_gb race on create volume

Because of the stat reporting mechanism used in Cinder and because we
don't update the allocated_capacity_gb in the volume service until the
volume's creation has been successfully completed we have race
conditions between the scheduler's value and the volume's value that may
induce the scheduler to provision more volumes than what it should
allow.

This patches fixes this by assuming that the create volume operation on
the volume service will be successful, and thus increases the
allocated_capacity_gb value when the operation starts and reverts the
increase if we reschedule the creation.

Closes-bug: #1751057
Change-Id: Ia321a08d102a9a4f535e46158764cb7f9bc81a9d
(cherry picked from commit bf6df89a9e2e5240610995a9ca80388365ac1700)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix allocated_capacity_gb race on create volume

Because of the stat reporting mechanism used in Cinder and because we
don't update the allocated_capacity_gb in the volume service until the
volume's creation has been successfully completed we have race
conditions between the scheduler's value and the volume's value that may
induce the scheduler to provision more volumes than what it should
allow.

This patches fixes this by assuming that the create volume operation on
the volume service will be successful, and thus increases the
allocated_capacity_gb value when the operation starts and reverts the
increase if we reschedule the creation.

Closes-bug: #1751057
Change-Id: Ia321a08d102a9a4f535e46158764cb7f9bc81a9d
(cherry picked from commit bf6df89a9e2e5240610995a9ca80388365ac1700)

VMAX driver currently has some limitations surrounding concurrent
operations involving replicated volumes. The next version of Unisphere
for VMAX has some improvements made in this area. One of these
improvements is on volume retrieval from the array. This patch switches
to the 90 endpoint on volume retrieval, where supported, to utilize
the improvement.

Change-Id: I0ac7f98e529961ab559289e257b4f58c8577e121

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Concurrency issues involving replicated volumes

VMAX driver currently has some limitations surrounding concurrent
operations involving replicated volumes. The next version of Unisphere
for VMAX has some improvements made in this area. One of these
improvements is on volume retrieval from the array. This patch switches
to the 90 endpoint on volume retrieval, where supported, to utilize
the improvement.

Change-Id: I0ac7f98e529961ab559289e257b4f58c8577e121
Closes-bug: 1753707
(cherry picked from commit 37439829281d9c475ab0518d4cd5f421ca94e1d8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-08 10:48:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix AZ not matching backend after migration

When we migrate, or retype with migration, a volume between availability
zones we are setting the AZ of the migrated volume to the same AZ as the
source volume, so we end up with a volume where the AZ does not match
the backend's AZ.

This patch fixes this issue for the generic migration code as well as
the optimized driver migration.

Change-Id: Ia1bf3ae0b7cd6d209354024848aef6029179d8e4
Closes-Bug: #1747949
(cherry picked from commit fb8085894b69f56091bde19683a919cb15d502cc)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix AZ not matching backend after migration

When we migrate, or retype with migration, a volume between availability
zones we are setting the AZ of the migrated volume to the same AZ as the
source volume, so we end up with a volume where the AZ does not match
the backend's AZ.

This patch fixes this issue for the generic migration code as well as
the optimized driver migration.

Change-Id: Ia1bf3ae0b7cd6d209354024848aef6029179d8e4
Closes-Bug: #1747949
(cherry picked from commit fb8085894b69f56091bde19683a919cb15d502cc)

commit_message:
Log config options with oslo.config

This removes some custom Cinder code which
handles filtering secret config options in a flaky way.

Filtering will now be based on the "secret=True" option
flag.

Related-Bug: #1750074
Change-Id: I1c404b057d1471c85bd7eaf5c096f5912293460a
(cherry picked from commit 7d278042c5280e40d5ed68f504f45ef023f05e18)
(cherry picked from commit 4bc52eb7ba35da9005c7d28c341b0ce408216572)

commit_message:
Unit testing for ini

- modifies custom module ini.py in such a way that its individual
  stages can be easily tested
- tests for this module (test_ini.py) are created

Change-Id: I0250837cc97705a7eb9eb81395aaeba86292bc89
Partial-Bug: #1594785
(cherry picked from commit dcb49e2ee0d7f7628ffa03720e7f22f38c08f94a)

[{'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-02-23 19:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-02-23 20:02:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm assuming this will probably never get merged, but in case someone else runs in to the same problem I did on Pike and earlier, here is the fix."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-02-23 23:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/547654/1/ : SUCCESS in 3h 17m 21s'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-28 16:32:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

> I'm assuming this will probably never get merged, but in case
 > someone else runs in to the same problem I did on Pike and earlier,
 > here is the fix.

Ok.  You clearly know this isn't appropriate for pike, if at all."}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-05 18:15:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Since it is a hard blocker to running nova multi-region over internal endpoints I will disagree that it is inappropriate "at all". I think it is still a valid wontfix bug affecting the Pike release.

As someone who actually has the need to run internal communications between OpenStack regions over internal endpoints for a production cloud, I hope your opinion that it may not be a valid case "at all" does not bear out in future releases. But thanks for the review and I accept the decision regarding Pike.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-09 14:41:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The use case is not inappropriate. The new config options in a stable release is the issue, which is why we aren't adding this to stable/pike. The full fix is in Queens but since it involves config options we can't backport it lest those cause upgrade issues for people on stable/pike."}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-09 16:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for clarifying.. makes sense to me'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-23 19:59:00.000000000', 'message': 'Allow os_interface and os_region_name on Keystone reqs

Allow the configuration options to specify os_region_name and
os_interface to be used when making requests to the identity API.

This fixes the situation where /v2.1/os-quota-sets always makes
requests to the Keystone public endpoint, which may not be
preferable in all environments.

Change-Id: Icfc336414de24f83d737452a6e06a420aa88391c
Closes-Bug: #1751349
'}]
commit_message:
Allow os_interface and os_region_name on Keystone reqs

Allow the configuration options to specify os_region_name and
os_interface to be used when making requests to the identity API.

This fixes the situation where /v2.1/os-quota-sets always makes
requests to the Keystone public endpoint, which may not be
preferable in all environments.

Change-Id: Icfc336414de24f83d737452a6e06a420aa88391c
Closes-Bug: #1751349

commit_message:
Documentation for deployments with TripleO/RDO

This commit extends the install section to explain how to deploy
with TripleO + quickstart.

Follow up patches will extend the details with diagrams and
initial resource creations.

Change-Id: I6163e053bfd46f3a1224a760373233df75be7b4c

commit_message:
Migrate release team deliverables to storyboard

The Release team has resolved to migrate its deliverables to SB.
Only openstack/reno has been utilizing LP so far so it is the only
one which needs to have its bug reports imported once this change
merges.

Change-Id: I8ea099b1e42cb0166b1bd6ebc94b2bcc1b82892d

commit_message:
django2: Drop SessionAuthenticationMiddleware

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/2.0/#miscellaneous
---
The SessionAuthenticationMiddleware class is removed. It provided
no functionality since session authentication is unconditionally
enabled in Django 1.10.
---

blueprint django2-support
Change-Id: I2767e01ec8879d6886152a0ed67f6738eb17209c

commit_message:
Remove deprecated 'deactivate_image' feature flag setting

'deactivate_image' feature flag was added long back during kilo
cycle. Tempest is going to remove this feature flag.

Depends-On: I843d4c64f24407d9d217005d5ea59d50d7ad62e7
Change-Id: I1ae8efc0e62acc5e05c1c00dc8970b74d8b16da0

Infiniband ports do not require the local_link_connection field to be
populated as the network topology is discoverable by the Infiniband
Subnet Manager.

This change removes the requirement for local_link_connection for
Infiniband ports. Infiniband ports have a client-id in their extra
field.

commit_message:
Don't validate local_link_connection when port has client-id

Infiniband ports do not require the local_link_connection field to be
populated as the network topology is discoverable by the Infiniband
Subnet Manager.

This change removes the requirement for local_link_connection for
Infiniband ports. Infiniband ports have a client-id in their extra
field.

Closes-Bug: #1753222
Change-Id: I2bfac4ccaf825bd9aa8ea0d2b447fcd7767acbc5
(cherry picked from commit dcebb77d9d7a2cebcc645dd632a12d224bd113c8)

subject: Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-09 10:54:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-09 10:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-09 13:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-09 13:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 10:54:45.000000000', 'message': "Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info and pin ceph-ansible SHA

1. The OpenStack infrastructure provides us with a list of mirrors
   which are already templated so this will simply the process of
   using those mirrors instead of the previous implementation which
   tries to derive the right URL's.
2. Instead of rewriting the host's sources file for Ubuntu, we leave
   it alone.
3. We place the overrides into a new override file to simplify the
   implementation and no longer require a bunch of conditionals in
   the user_variables template. Some more clean-up can be done, but
   it will follow on later.
4. The ceph-ansible project has created a new library which is held
   in the root folder of the repo. We need to ensure that the library
   path is included, but that results in other breakages. To help
   get patches moving through the system again we pin the SHA to just
   prior the upstream changes.
5. The MariaDB mirror setting has been removed due to the default
   MariaDB setup being done via a specific pin. The apt repo setup
   for MariaDB is no longer being used.

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/install_packages.yml

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: Ib908e5503ecc93255d554d027ec62539c6316099
(cherry picked from commit 90c130575d069ca8ffe850f137e40317c0ad88f1)
"}, {'created': '2018-03-09 10:55:45.000000000', 'message': "Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info

1. The OpenStack infrastructure provides us with a list of mirrors
   which are already templated so this will simply the process of
   using those mirrors instead of the previous implementation which
   tries to derive the right URL's.
2. Instead of rewriting the host's sources file for Ubuntu, we leave
   it alone.
3. We place the overrides into a new override file to simplify the
   implementation and no longer require a bunch of conditionals in
   the user_variables template. Some more clean-up can be done, but
   it will follow on later.
5. The MariaDB mirror setting has been removed due to the default
   MariaDB setup being done via a specific pin. The apt repo setup
   for MariaDB is no longer being used.

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/install_packages.yml

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: Ib908e5503ecc93255d554d027ec62539c6316099
(cherry picked from commit 90c130575d069ca8ffe850f137e40317c0ad88f1)

commit_message:
Clean-up gate code to use mirror_info

1. The OpenStack infrastructure provides us with a list of mirrors
   which are already templated so this will simply the process of
   using those mirrors instead of the previous implementation which
   tries to derive the right URL's.
2. Instead of rewriting the host's sources file for Ubuntu, we leave
   it alone.
3. We place the overrides into a new override file to simplify the
   implementation and no longer require a bunch of conditionals in
   the user_variables template. Some more clean-up can be done, but
   it will follow on later.
5. The MariaDB mirror setting has been removed due to the default
   MariaDB setup being done via a specific pin. The apt repo setup
   for MariaDB is no longer being used.

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/install_packages.yml

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: Ib908e5503ecc93255d554d027ec62539c6316099
(cherry picked from commit 90c130575d069ca8ffe850f137e40317c0ad88f1)

commit_message:
Allow mox-free horizon plugins to consume horizon test helper

horizon test helpers now depend on mox3.
This prevents horizon plugins from consuming the test helpers
even if a plugin itself is mox free.
This commit makes mox import optional.

Change-Id: I631518d8f4cd9641920f68cd1e405298ddb7965a
Closes-Bug: #1753555

subject: Drop kingbird, networking-hpe and trio2o from g-r sync
messages:
[{'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-03-07 09:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-07 15:10:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

have you talked with those projects?  (preferably via a bug or on the list)  I'd prefer a positive ack from them acking the removal"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-07 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

To drop from g-r-sync, you need to remove from openstack/projects.txt.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-07 15:38:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

let'S first remove from openstack/requirements/projects.txt.

But even then this change is not needed, they might still keep this job to not let others in..."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-03-07 21:51:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-03-07 21:52:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

There is a bug linked in the commit message, and I haven't been able to find a contact point for those projects as they're not in the governance repo."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-07 23:31:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm inclined to agree with Andreas, we can't add a project to projects.txt without them hving these jobs but a project can have these jobs if they choose.

When they hit a problem each project can choose how to solve it, either drop these jobs or fix requirements and re-add the sync.

Also given we hope to drop the syncing at some stage this cycle perhaps these projects are just trail-blazers ;P"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-08 07:18:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm perfectly fine removing them from projects.txt - but would leave the job in.

The job you remove is not g-r sync directy.

-1 seens you have circular depends-on (on itself)"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-03-08 07:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-03-08 07:23:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

If we leave the job in then that project isn't going to be able to merge any other change anymore because we dropped one of the requirements of their project from the g-r list. 

are you saying this is the best way to notify them that they should sync the requirements if they didn't do so in the last year?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-08 07:26:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The requirements-check only blocks changing single lines in requirements files.

They could still add a new line - or merge any other change.'}, {'account_id': 24064, 'date': '2018-03-09 08:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> The requirements-check only blocks changing single lines in
 > requirements files.
 > 
 > They could still add a new line - or merge any other change.

I totally agree with Andreas and we are not using tempest-lib anymore in the code as well as in the requirements, thanks to andreas for the commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536191/
and we need that requirements-check for Kingbird.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-03-09 15:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

as explained offline by AJ, this might not be strictly necessary'}, {'account_id': 24064, 'date': '2018-03-09 15:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Dirk,
I’m taking care of all the kingbird activities from this cycle and project management is a bit new for me  
My question is 
how  to avoid all the 210 revisions from kingbird... and be updated with global requirements ??'}]

commit_message:
Drop kingbird, networking-hpe and trio2o from g-r sync

They have not merged any propsed updates for quite some time
(between 170 and 210 revisions) so it doesn't look like people
are particularly interested in keeping in sync. Also, these
projects still use tempest-lib which has been deprecated and
is unmaintained, and we'd like to remove it from the g-r repo.

See

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/472085/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/502688/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/456029/

Related-Bug: #1753969
Depends-On: Id5e2206476ae10f118678aaf41d6fb197429128d
Change-Id: Ie63ac20e452cd6cde6cbb0e629d8d8c8fb5adf38

handle the NOT_LOCKED status and treat it as an error.

The reason to treat it as an error is because, when the connection with
the OVSDB is reestabilished we don't know if that transaction will

commit_message:
Transaction: Handle NOT_LOCKED status

This patch is changing the commit_block() from the Transaction class to
handle the NOT_LOCKED status and treat it as an error.

The reason to treat it as an error is because, when the connection with
the OVSDB is reestabilished we don't know if that transaction will
belong to a worker that is holding a valid lock or not, so we won't
attempt to retry it.

The patch is also adding a log for unknown status, in case another
status that is not handled by ovsdbapp is returned the log will give us
some hints about what's going on instead of failing siently.

Related-Bug: #1754291
Change-Id: I5dcb226c387092cba1adb9dbf1ec782e0bac66ba

commit_message:
fixed_key: By default use a hardcoded fixed_key across devstack envs

This change mimics how fixed_key would actually be deployed in a real
world environment, with a single key shared across Nova and Cinder
across all hosts.

Change-Id: I50a48e2da57a1cc1ecd250150ea6e9c3745baaca
(cherry picked from commit 13833489e5ce5b2fba0d81d9a65d3795ad394fa4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 15:36:41.000000000', 'message': 'Allow a non-127.0.0.1 definition for the hostname.

In some environments it might be useful to resolve the hostname to
an IP address that is reachable by other hosts in the local network.
If some of the configuration scripts have taken care of putting
a proper line in /etc/hosts, do not try to override it by appending
a 127.0.0.1 one.

Change-Id: I7ae20a66c473b0c683803cc44654cd95fcce3639
Closes-Bug: 1746751
'}]
commit_message:
Allow a non-127.0.0.1 definition for the hostname.

In some environments it might be useful to resolve the hostname to
an IP address that is reachable by other hosts in the local network.
If some of the configuration scripts have taken care of putting
a proper line in /etc/hosts, do not try to override it by appending
a 127.0.0.1 one.

Change-Id: I7ae20a66c473b0c683803cc44654cd95fcce3639
Closes-Bug: 1746751

commit_message:
Allow not resolving outputs on get stacks

Depending on the stack complexity, resolving outputs of a Heat stack can
be fairly expensive. The API has a parameter to disable output
resolution: this adds this parameter to the get_stack call, and use it
in places where outputs are superfluous.

This is a copy of shade commit b1bc65c599812a02f6861c1d80c31c3b9be894da.

Change-Id: I932e42fe10af7de7d3a08182328ff2c8c70e8f9e

cycle. Tempest is going to remove this feature flag.

commit_message:
Retire cue - Part 1

Cue has been retired in mid 2016 as official project and did not
contineu, it's time to retire it completely.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128095.html

Change-Id: I85db81d3e1907f23d5a7c12ed3bcaef3e95f39ae

commit_message:
Add releasenotes to mark the start of Queens support

This commit adds the releasenote to start the Queens support
and needed for version 0.3.0 to release.

Change-Id: I5eecc125b5a09e33d15fdccdcd39f5ad68b115fe

'}, {'created': '2018-03-09 10:59:44.000000000', 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.
This patch also removes some quotes from some variables.

Change-Id: Ib131554bce0d7a77eef20716ac11171a284d1e48

commit_message:
hardware: Rework get_number_of_serial_ports

Make this use '_get_flavor_image_meta', thus reducing duplication.

Change-Id: I340001e433d07321c75795648d9c6bc7b16598dd

commit_message:
hardware: Rework '_get_cpu_topology_constraints'

There were four issues (two of them related) with this function:

- It didn't use the standardized way of extracting flavor extra specs
  and image metadata, meaning code duplication
- It used funky values (-1, 65536) to determine if a value was set or
  not
- The logging routines lied, printing out requests for flavor properties
  that the user never actually configured
- The log and exception messages were rubbish

Rework this function to both use '_get_flavor_image_meta' and correctly
"set" unset values to 0, and clean up the logs to show some useful
information.

Change-Id: Ia99d2e4e502d6fa13572727a9dabc617f472cb0f

commit_message:
Fix py35 python tests

In python3, dict.values() is a dictview, which cannot be indexed.

This change also makes the tox py35 job voting and adds it to the gate
jobs.

Change-Id: I925e53c2e20a75fef1a942003f5e61f6bfeedcdc
Story: #2001637

commit_message:
Add initial in-repo Zuul jobs

This change ensures parity with the CI jobs run by TravisCI on the
legacy StackHPC github repo.

In addition to the system-required job in infra project-config, the
following jobs are run on check and gate:

- openstack-tox-pep8
- openstack-tox-py27
- build-openstack-sphinx-docs
- kayobe-tox-ansible-syntax
- kayobe-tox-ansible

Ansible molecule tests are not working currently, as they require docker
engine to be running.

Change-Id: Ie95bcdaabb10ab661bc3a01efbaf9143896d6913
Story: #2001637
Task: #6646

commit_message:
Update upper-constraints consumption

In order to deal with horizon going into the upper-constraints file so
that horizon plugins can consume it normally, we need to align the
constraints invocation in horizon's tox.ini. This means putting the -C
argument into the dependencies list rather than the pip install line so
that it doesn't get appended to tox installing horizon itself.

While we're in here, move nosehtmloutput into test-requirements so that
we don't need to do .[test] which also doesn't work with constraints.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/550475
Change-Id: I736f79010c2d34e25d41d967a38128c2263ed13f

subject: Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-16 16:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-16 18:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-27 20:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-28 16:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck

Upper constraints checking patch now landed. Looks like that was the issue for installing this.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-02 10:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-13 19:32:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-12-20 06:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2017-12-21 14:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-24 02:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Erno, could you take another look if you get a chance? I think we may still run into trouble without this change.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-03-06 12:58:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Still not really clear why this is a problem and how release notes would be version independent (They are very specifically tied to a single version that is being released).

I'm not exactly against this change, just would like to understand why we thought it was needed in the first place and why we are now leaving those empty instead of removing them entirely if they are not needed."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-06 13:39:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

There'S one release notes document covering *all* releases on docs.openstack.org. We do not have separate builds - just one document that includes information about all releases.

As such, the version number of the individual releases is not the right thing to use. And if you remove the version number completely, a git based number is used. So, setting it to empty is the only way to have no version number set.

Note that this is how it's done for many other repos already - we learned a bit and thus changed the setup over time."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-03-09 10:01:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

> There'S one release notes document covering *all* releases on
 > docs.openstack.org. We do not have separate builds - just one
 > document that includes information about all releases.
 > 
 > As such, the version number of the individual releases is not the
 > right thing to use. And if you remove the version number
 > completely, a git based number is used. So, setting it to empty is
 > the only way to have no version number set.
 > 
 > Note that this is how it's done for many other repos already - we
 > learned a bit and thus changed the setup over time.

Thanks Andreas!

Now this makes absolutely sense. Just wasn't exactly clear why this mechanism was the right way to do it."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 16:54:55.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release values.
We've found that most projects now require the service package to be
installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely due to
the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

Change-Id: I9c1154453f5a5263771e42b0eb5ebdc3a78ffc16
Needed-by: I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release values.
We've found that most projects now require the service package to be
installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely due to
the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

Change-Id: I9c1154453f5a5263771e42b0eb5ebdc3a78ffc16
Needed-by: I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 14:49:12.000000000', 'message': 'Adds --role and --primary-role as required for upgrade run

This adds the new --role and --primary-role required parameters
for the upgrade run command. The --role to specify the role you
wish to upgrade and --primary-role identifies the name of the
primary controlplane role in your deployment.

The --nodes parameter becomes optional and cannot be used
when the primary role is upgraded.

TODO more tests but want discussion first.

  openstack overcloud upgrade run --role Controller
				  --primary-role Controller
  openstack overcloud upgrade run --role Compute
                                  --primary-role Controller
				  --nodes overcloud-compute-0

If we want to stay stateless then we need to force the operator
to specify their primary role. There is no default sane option
when it comes to role names, especially for the Controller
whatever it is called in the upgrade environment. On the upside
it forces the operator to consider which is their primary role
and make sure they understand those nodes will be upgraded
together.

WDYT?
Change-Id: I0418883557113b5a67cfeaf181614dc5fe32ca94
'}, {'created': '2018-03-07 12:16:15.000000000', 'message': "P..Q openstack overcloud upgrade add roles and nodes params

This adds a required, mutually exclusive argument group for
--roles and --nodes. --roles replaces the existing --role.

This shifts the semantics of upgrading 'one at a time' (compute)
to 'all together' (controller) to the operator. You can either
specify roles or nodes but not both. Using nodes for contollers
is not supported but we can only warn.

  openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller
  openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes overcloud-compute-0 overcloud-compute-1
  #for the really ambitious
  openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller Networker

Change-Id: I0418883557113b5a67cfeaf181614dc5fe32ca94
"}, {'created': '2018-03-08 10:45:56.000000000', 'message': "P..Q Add roles and nodes params to overcloud upgrade run cli

commit_message:
Add --roles and --nodes params to overcloud upgrade run cli

This adds a required, mutually exclusive argument group for
--roles and --nodes. --roles replaces the existing --role.

This shifts the semantics of upgrading 'one at a time' (compute)
vs 'all together' (controller) to the operator. You can either
specify roles or nodes but not both. Using nodes for contollers
is not supported but we can only warn.

  openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller
  openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes overcloud-compute-0 overcloud-compute-1
  #for the really ambitious
  openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller Networker

Change-Id: I0418883557113b5a67cfeaf181614dc5fe32ca94

subject: Support creating VNFFG with no flow-classifier

Hi P :)

I cannot imagine how it works. Do you deploy the chain without classifier? so how will it create the chain via Networking SFC? And what reason do you need to propose this patch? I already mentioned in the previous comment, Tacker team really want to abstract VNFFG. IMHO, that is somehow up to Networking SFC team. With the current patch description, I cannot catch.'}, {'account_id': 25505, 'date': '2018-01-30 12:43:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

 > I cannot imagine how it works. Do you deploy the chain without
 > classifier? so how will it create the chain via Networking SFC? And
 > what reason do you need to propose this patch? I already mentioned
 > in the previous comment, Tacker team really want to abstract VNFFG.
 > IMHO, that is somehow up to Networking SFC team. If you have an
 > idea to abstract the classifier, it will be perfect. With the
 > current patch description, I cannot catch.

Tung I can help you understand how this works. Networking-sfc is supporting create a chain without any classifier and down the road you can update the chain and add any classifiers if you want dynamically. In Networking-sfc the chains and classifiers are completely decoupled which means that you can create classifiers without chain and vice versa.'}, {'account_id': 20560, 'date': '2018-01-30 13:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thank Dimitrious for explaining how it works.But I think Tacker is more abstracted level than Networking SFC. For VNFFG, Tacker target for end-2-end services. If you guys think coupling classifier and the chain is painful and you want to easily change classifiers, I think you can come up with "parameterized" method. My only point is that Tacker should be kept abstracted :) Please clarify if I am wrong. Thanks'}, {'account_id': 25505, 'date': '2018-01-30 13:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Thank Dimitrious for explaining how it works.But I think Tacker is
 > more abstracted level than Networking SFC. For VNFFG, Tacker target
 > for end-2-end services. If you guys think coupling classifier and
 > the chain is painful and you want to easily change classifiers, I
 > think you can come up with "parameterized" method. My only point is
 > that Tacker should be kept abstracted :) Please clarify if I am
 > wrong. Thanks

Creating a VNFFG with an empty classifier and have the ability to update this VNFFG [1] and add classifiers doesn't cancel the abstraction notion of Tacker. The abstact logic that tacker adds through the VNFFG templates is that you can manipulate all the chains, classifiers and the VNFs that you are gonna use in your system through the VNFFG template. Which means that in tacker you can create all the aforementioned with one step(VNFFG template) while in networking-sfc you need four steps (create classifiers,port-pairs,port-pair-groups,port-chain) and that is an indication that tacker is abstract enough. To be able to create a vnffg with an empty classifier doesn't alter the very nature of the VNFFG because you created a forwarding graph with a classifier which is empty wich is ok because the user maybe wants to be able to alter the direction of the traffic that goes through through the VNFFG1 to the  VNFFG2 so he can be able to maintain the VNFs which are used in VNFGG1 for example.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531817/'}, {'account_id': 20560, 'date': '2018-01-30 14:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

attached policy.

decoupled. This patch lets user can do it by allow creating
VNFFG with no flow-classifier. User also have the ability to
update VNFFG by adding some flow-classifiers.

In the future, Tacker also support alter the direction of
the traffic though update the patch from VNFFG1 to VNFFG2.

According to SFC RFC standard, the chains should be decoupled
from classifiers.

In Networking-sfc the chains and classifiers are completely
decoupled. This patch lets user can do it by allow creating
VNFFG with no flow-classifier.

User can use "tosca-vnffgd-no-classifier-sample.yaml" to create
VNFFG with no flow-classifier. User also have the ability to
add flow-classifiers through updating VNFFG with
"tosca-vnffgd-sample.yaml" in vnffgd tosca templates folder.

This patch only support Forwarding path with type
"tosca.nodes.nfv.FP.TackerV2". Tacker also support altering the
direction of the traffic in forwarding path, update new
forwarding path, add, remove and update flow-classifers though
updating VNFFG.

For more information: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531817

Change-Id: Ice2f0f03f7a90f4fefdee751283ff26b9c037d87
Closes-Bug: #1745818
'}, {'created': '2018-02-28 02:04:32.000000000', 'message': 'Support creating VNFFG with no flow-classifier

VNFFG with no flow-classifier. User also have the ability to
add flow-classifiers through updating VNFFG with
"tosca-vnffgd-sample.yaml" in vnffgd tosca templates folder.

This patch only support Forwarding path with type
"tosca.nodes.nfv.FP.TackerV2". Tacker also support altering the
direction of the traffic in forwarding path, update new
forwarding path, add, remove and update flow-classifers though
updating VNFFG.

For more information: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531817

Change-Id: Ice2f0f03f7a90f4fefdee751283ff26b9c037d87
Closes-Bug: #1745818
'}]
commit_message:
Support creating VNFFG with no flow-classifier

According to SFC RFC standard, the chains should be decoupled
from classifiers.

In Networking-sfc the chains and classifiers are completely
decoupled. This patch lets user can do it by allow creating
VNFFG with no flow-classifier.

User can use "tosca-vnffgd-no-classifier-sample.yaml" to create
VNFFG with no flow-classifier. User also have the ability to
add flow-classifiers through updating VNFFG with
"tosca-vnffgd-sample.yaml" in vnffgd tosca templates folder.

This patch only support Forwarding path with type
"tosca.nodes.nfv.FP.TackerV2". Tacker also support altering the
direction of the traffic in forwarding path, update new
forwarding path, add, remove and update flow-classifers though
updating VNFFG.

For more information: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531817

Change-Id: Ice2f0f03f7a90f4fefdee751283ff26b9c037d87
Closes-Bug: #1745818

When VM with volume do live migration, it will always fail with
exception VDI_NOT_IN_MAP, this is because XenServer xapi has
restricted check on the vdi:sr mapping. This patch is to provide
correct mapping information.

Close-Bugs: 1704071
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] XenAPI: Fix vm live migration problem with volume

When VM with volume do live migration, it will always fail with
exception VDI_NOT_IN_MAP, this is because XenServer xapi has
restricted check on the vdi:sr mapping. This patch is to provide
correct mapping information.

Change-Id: I45a81c8d7d64981d5dc6b61435489b62738f6f10
Close-Bugs: 1704071

commit_message:
Introduce db sync check feature

Lite-spec for a dry-run option for db upgrades in glance-manage.

This spec is moved from /specs/untargeted/glance/lite-spec-db-sync-check.rst
to /specs/queens/implemented/glance/lite-spec-db-sync-check.rst because it was
implemented by change I1e0b02d615690f65a17b4ccfe4e4a72cc9e15ada

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-08 12:20:20.000000000', 'message': 'Configure deploy logs for Ironic

This change allows configuring whether and how Ironic stores ramdisk
logs from the deployment process. By default, logs are stored locally
in /var/log/ironic/deploy (this matches the upstream defaults).
The logs are stored on every deployment if debug is enabled, otherwise
only on failed deployments.

Change-Id: Iab481f67cf8a844b47d791130a428a5ca06bb454
'}]
commit_message:
Configure deploy logs for Ironic

This change allows configuring whether and how Ironic stores ramdisk
logs from the deployment process. By default, logs are stored locally
in /var/log/ironic/deploy (this matches the upstream defaults).
The logs are stored on every deployment if debug is enabled, otherwise
only on failed deployments.

Change-Id: Iab481f67cf8a844b47d791130a428a5ca06bb454

commit_message:
Fix Uuid and virtual_free elements load error

NotImplementedError are reported in decision-engine log file
when we activate storage data model and see a Guru Meditation Report.
This patch fixes by adding default values.

Change-Id: I06386f8295f7758cbb633612eee8b19225905c92
Closes-Bug: #1750300

commit_message:
Fix keystone v3 support with swift backend

Refactor configuration for mitaka onwards, where the
authentication details for swift storage are in a new
glance-swift.conf configuration file.

Update for Keystone v3 support as required for
queens or later, where the v2 API has been dropped.

Closes-Bug: 1752027
Depends-On: Ie6e2733f34de10a4d34b18dbf1fd9ba623af0e18
Change-Id: Ibcc36ca22d72d310921f840e6081608be1fbc7e1

commit_message:
Include ansible-role-redhat-subscription into tripleo

ansible-role-redhat-subscription is an Ansible role mainly maintained by
people working on TripleO now.

We would like to use OpenStack release management, so the project needs
to be part of OpenStack, so we'll include it in TripleO.

Change-Id: I9762658117bc0081482996a6387fabdd224311c6

LOL eric'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-05 18:35:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-06 08:54:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-06 08:55:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We'll need to check with the Telemetry team that they are ok with you handling ceilometer-powervm. Pretty sure they are, but it's always better to check."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2018-02-07 19:44:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

good with me.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-02-08 13:48:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-02-08 13:52:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:12:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

One question that was raised during the TC office hour today is around open collaboration.

The point behind creating official OpenStack project teams is that it creates fair open collaboration grounds, a level playing field where every organization and individual can contribute as an equal. There is little point in creating an OpenStack team (and submitting that team to the oversight of the OpenStack Technical Committee) if the playground is so tilted only one company will ever contribute to it.

When we develop software that is linked to proprietary software of hardware, there is always a risk when specific members of the team have access to information that gives them an unfair advantage compared to other team members.

Is there such critical information in your team ? If yes, how do you plan to ensure a fair open collaboration ground within this team ?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-11 21:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-11 21:38:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-02-13 09:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

Seems a good thing alongside the winstakers group. This seems almost more open for participation for me.'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-02-14 15:39:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Great question, Thierry.

IBM is certainly not the only party interested in Power systems, any more than Microsoft is the only party interested in Hyper-V. One example of another company that you may see contributing in the future is Tech Mahindra [1]. But we welcome and encourage any organization or individual to contribute to the projects here. We have already seen sporadic contributions from non-IBMers over the past several releases, and hope very much to see that continue and grow going forward.

Note that the winstackers group is tied to proprietary software in the same way that this would be. Perhaps more so, as IBM is making very substantial efforts to open more and more to outside parties. E.g. We started the OpenPower Foundation [2] in 2013 to open things up even down to the chip level. That has a ton of members [3] at this point. Most relevant here, we have open sourced the library [4] that is used by the openstack/(nova|networking|ceilometer)-powervm projects included here for managing Power systems. This should allow anyone to propose changes.

I have no interest in keeping this an IBM-only group. Nothing would make me happier than to see non-IBMers become core contributors.

[1] https://www.techmahindra.com/media/press_releases/techmahindra-ibm-power9.aspx
[2] https://openpowerfoundation.org/
[3] https://openpowerfoundation.org/membership/current-members/
[4] https://github.com/powervm/pypowervm'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-15 09:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks Matthew for the precision. The fact that the library this team is mostly interacting with is also open source alleviates a lot of my concerns in terms of establishing a level playing field.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-15 11:04:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-15 17:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-03-06 08:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Alright, this has had majority for a while now. It will be approved on Friday unless new objections are posted.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-03-08 15:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-03-09 09:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add PowerStackers project

The nova-powervm, networking-powervm, and ceilometer-powervm
deliverables have been around for a while, but only
ceilometer-powervm was under governance (as part of the Telemetry
project). This creates a new project under governance where we can
include all of the *-powervm projects, so that they will all be
under governance together.

Change-Id: I1b709623df535b662871e9db2bac59b6f55f5277

That is OAUTH.  Do we need a separate mechanism for that?'}, {'account_id': 12542, 'date': '2016-11-17 09:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Patch Set 5:

> That is OAUTH.  Do we need a separate mechanism for that?

For trusts this in their current state, this is like OAUTH yes. Much like OAUTH, they currently only allow role delegation. If https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396331/ is implemented this allows more restrictions than plain OAUTH (i.e. capabilities, endpoints), though.

On the authentication side OAUTH could be used to obtain tokens scoped to the trust. To this end, one could amend the OAUTH spec with an additional requested_trust_id parameter for the "Create Request Token" parameter which causes the requested service tokens to be scoped to the trust rather than a project.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2016-11-18 02:35:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Hi Johannes,

I have a just a few questions inline.  Looking forward to discussing this a bit more.'}, {'account_id': 12542, 'date': '2016-11-18 12:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12542, 'date': '2016-11-18 12:30:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(5 comments)

Thanks for your comments, Lance! I clarified the spec a bit to reflect them (feel free to comment on parts that didn't properly clarify). 

Other than that I'd like to have a bit of a discussion about OAUTH vs. the authentication scheme I cooked up for consuming standalone trusts (or a different scheme entirely). See my last inline comment for my thoughts on that."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-18 12:32:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

commit_message:
Added spec on standalone trusts

This specification describes a mechanism for allowing
standalone trusts, that do not require a trustee user.
Instead, these trusts are consumed using an API key.

Change-Id: I77ac10bab5b8ec728a2cdfb638dd2e001966fa08

commit_message:
XtremIO: fix fetching FC targets from X2 array

Previous versions of XtremIO had the type as part of the target name, in
X2 this convention was changed and a driver updated is required to query
the type from the target object.

Closes-Bug: #1702458
Change-Id: Ie62d7bc84b8b0e54ff627a52763e93456ff45d65
(cherry picked from commit 67facebe4d9996bcbe8b3aaffd0a0d78660649e7)

Just a thought -- what is the reason we don't do this? It isn't an

commit_message:
Return listener statistics as part of a Listener GET

Just a thought -- what is the reason we don't do this? It isn't an
expensive operation, and a GET should return everything relevant?

Change-Id: Ic94c4566be6ed8095a456bf2ed6b8826f7e3a1a3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-03 16:39:46.000000000', 'message': "Drop back to docker 2.7.0

In docker 3.1.0, APIClient.export, APIClient.get_archive and
APIClient.get_image now return generators streaming the raw
binary data from the server’s response. This change makes Zun
gate jobs failed with exception [1]:

AttributeError: 'generator' object has no attribute 'read'

Temporarily roll back to the 2.7.0 version until we find
the way to solve the bug.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/45/548445/8/check/zun-tempest-docker-sql/bf95c73/logs/testr_results.html.gz

Change-Id: Ia0458a220b9f141ab0061fe2cad1098afafe501e
Partial-Bug: #1753080
"}]
commit_message:
Drop back to docker 2.7.0

In docker 3.1.0, APIClient.export, APIClient.get_archive and
APIClient.get_image now return generators streaming the raw
binary data from the server’s response. This change makes Zun
gate jobs failed with exception [1]:

AttributeError: 'generator' object has no attribute 'read'

Temporarily roll back to the 2.7.0 version until we find
the way to solve the bug.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/45/548445/8/check/zun-tempest-docker-sql/bf95c73/logs/testr_results.html.gz

Change-Id: Ia0458a220b9f141ab0061fe2cad1098afafe501e
Partial-Bug: #1753080

commit_message:
ffu: Introduce Neutron fast-forward upgrade tasks

fast_forward_upgrade_tasks for neutron covering Ocata and Pike.
- Service status check
- Stop service when updating from Ocata to Pike
- Update neutron package
- Db sync

bp fast-forward-upgrades
Change-Id: I8858bbab2d5ec0e5a88fff3275368711a0bf8a8a

[{'created': '2018-01-15 16:44:31.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add fast_forward_upgrade_tasks for ceilometer services

Adds ffu_tasks for ceilometer - stop services on step 2
and package updates on step 6. In the docker/ templates
services are also disabled. Since there is no -api template
the package update is with each service rather than -api as is
the pattern on the other ffu_tasks (see topic branch)

Lots of changes for ceilo-* since Newton:
 --> openstack-ceilometer-api, -collector and -expirer are removed
     in Pike and no longer referenced in the templates at all. TODO
     add ffu_tasks for removal of these... ceilometer-base.yaml?
 --> openstack-ceilometer-agent-ipmi is new in pike and needs to
     be installed.

Change-Id: I1c8ac2285ab222cfb7cb7ff898d222ae6e846567

commit_message:
Add fast_forward_upgrade_tasks for ceilometer services

Adds ffu_tasks for ceilometer - stop services on step 1.
In the docker/ templates services are also disabled.

Lots of changes for ceilo-* since Newton:
  --> openstack-ceilometer-api, -collector and -expirer are
      removed in Pike and no longer in the templates. The disable
      files are re-added by the parent review so these services
      can be retired with ffu_tasks.
  --> The disabled services are set back in environment for Fast
      Forward Upgrade

Change-Id: I1c8ac2285ab222cfb7cb7ff898d222ae6e846567

commit_message:
FFU: Fix nova fast forward steps

We need to check the running services only on step 0. We need
to provide correct nova_cell0 DB url.

commit_message:
fixed_key: By default use a hardcoded fixed_key across devstack envs

This change mimics how fixed_key would actually be deployed in a real
world environment, with a single key shared across Nova and Cinder
across all hosts.

Change-Id: I50a48e2da57a1cc1ecd250150ea6e9c3745baaca

from ceph mon node [0], but the site.yml missing it.

commit_message:
[upstream] Remove Task Tracking & Reg/Accounts Sections

To bring things in line with what exists in the contributor
guide, the task tracking content has been removed and so has
the section on registration and accounts.

During trainings, the contributor guide will be used instead of walking
through slides to make the training even more interactive. After the
guide is completed, we can do exericses corresponding to the section
of the guide, if we have them.

Change-Id: I1e00155e876d8f50add93bc449e63891006580c5

miss genericswitch mac address

If we miss the genericswitch mac address in config file,
the neutron server won't find the switch.

Change-Id: Ie014e3dce5f56942202641e123c430dd94e5e4b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 19:01:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes test_metrics test

Ceilometer API was removed in Queens, meaning that test_metrics has
not way to validate the metrics collected by the ceilometer-polling
agent.

The metrics are instead sent and collected by Gnocchi.

This patch adds a Gnocchi client, and updates the test_metrics
to use this client properly.

Change-Id: Id999d758505de10abb356befb854736e1904f6ee
'}, {'created': '2018-02-22 13:46:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes test_metrics test

Ceilometer API was removed in Queens, meaning that test_metrics has
not way to validate the metrics collected by the ceilometer-polling
agent.

The metrics are instead sent and collected by Gnocchi.

This patch adds a Gnocchi client, and updates the test_metrics
to use this client properly.

commit_message:
Fixes test_metrics test

Ceilometer API was removed in Queens, meaning that test_metrics has
not way to validate the metrics collected by the ceilometer-polling
agent.

The metrics are instead sent and collected by Gnocchi.

This patch adds a Gnocchi client, and updates the test_metrics
to use this client properly.

Change-Id: Id999d758505de10abb356befb854736e1904f6ee

subject: Pending-delete rollback ability
messages:
[{'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-09-11 01:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-11 01:56:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-glance-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/67/502367/1/check/gate-glance-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/6e45e96//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 04s
- gate-glance-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/67/502367/1/check/gate-glance-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/576e384/ : SUCCESS in 2m 34s'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2017-09-20 16:12:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So this has been discussed before. The problem with the restore as user based action is that as the scrubber is it's own process we would be ending up with quite nasty race conditions. Yes, restoring the image currently is a hack (admin needs to make sure scrubber is not running/deleting the actual data yet and then tap into the database to change the image status back to active), but it's still better option than allowing those races to form where scrubber is already deleting the data but the image gets set to active.

IIRC the bigger point for delayed delete was so that the operator can specify quiet backend times for the deletion and the client does not need to be waiting for that synchronous delete to happen, rather than having a way to rever the delete."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-09-21 19:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am against this in principle. The point of pending-delete is to allow asynchronous deletions, particularly for the swift backend, where image data must be broken into segments.  Some experiments in Rackspace public cloud put the "sweet spot" for segments at about 256MB, and when the average image size is around 40GB, that's a lot of segments, and if you wait to return deletion success until all segments have been deleted, that's a long time.  I think we should take a strong stance that deletion in Glance is final.

Not -2'ing because I don't want to prematurely close off discussion.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-10-05 13:51:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I'm against this proposal.  Open to other opinions, but it will take some convincing."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-10-06 12:35:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We decided at the weekly Glance meeting (5 Oct 2017) that this will not be accepted into Queens.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2017-10-09 06:27:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

OK, leave it here. Let's come back later if necessary."}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-01 16:34:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So enhance glance-scrubber instead of exposing a new API seems a better way. I'll update the spce later according to the discussion during PTG:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/glance-rocky-delete-rollback"}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-02 16:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-05 02:32:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-05 02:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-05 03:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-06 11:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-06 13:44:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

This captures what we discussed at the Dublin PTG.  I have a few clarifications I'd like you to make so that people don't get the wrong idea about the ability this implementation will provide."}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-07 01:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-07 01:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-03-08 13:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

Looks good!'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-03-09 07:02:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-11 01:52:59.000000000', 'message': 'Pending-delete rollback ability

Glance support soft delete images with delayed_delete feature. If this
feature is open, when users delete a image, the image will be in
pending-delete status first. And then will be deleted by scrubber worker.

But obviously, there is no way to revert the pending-delete images. When
use delayed_delete feature in Glance by the administrator, it usually
means that people need to think/do more about the delete action and give
them a chance to regret. So once the users want to revert the delete
action, Glance should give them this kind of ability.

This bp will create a new API in Glance, which could be called like:
v2/images/{images}/actions/revert. With this api, users can rollback the
pending-delete image status to active.

Change-Id: I0202b754815a3d2133a57ef987741c7b12c29ff3
blueprint: pending-delete-rollback

commit_message:
Pending-delete rollback ability

Glance support soft delete images with delayed_delete feature. If
this feature is open, when users delete a image, the image will
first be in a special 'pending_delete' status that is not displayed
in the API response. And then the image will be deleted by
glance-scrubber process.

But currently, there is no way to revert the pending-delete images.
Once the admin operators want to revert the delete action, Glance
should give them this kind of ability.

This patch will enhance the glance-scrubber tool to support restoring
the image from pending-delete to active. Although, whether the rollback
of a particular image is possible or not depends upon Glance configuration
option settings and quick operator action.

Change-Id: I0202b754815a3d2133a57ef987741c7b12c29ff3
blueprint: pending-delete-rollback

[{'created': '2018-03-09 06:31:20.000000000', 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or

commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or
lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ifa91f90658a70dcedd00a3e036e3f241746e5bd1

commit_message:
Put the LOG outside of "with" statement.

If some errors occur in statement in the "with" statement,
we can't get the info or debug logs.

Closes-bug: #1754317

Change-Id: Iacd15eec09077c315a0a0c47c5bf634fa0769369

commit_message:
Fix exception string format

The string %(action) is not valid, it misses the conversion specified,
add s for string.

Note that this leads to an untranslatable string, since our translation
tools check for valid formats and fail. In this case the failure comes
from a source code fail.

Change-Id: I2e630928dc32542a8a7c02657a9f0ab1eaab62ff

commit_message:
Improve the net_resolv_pre_kube function in network.sh

Change overwrite to append /etc/resolv.conf, as in my test envrionment it
need specific nameserver for specific domain, if overwrite all the content
in resolv.conf will not install correctly.

Change-Id: I8355c2e00ccd686b48a42f13d7e3de05defa88a8

[{'created': '2018-03-08 06:58:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix one issue in setup_gate.sh

I didn't understand why add /opt/stack/new, but if don't have
/opt/stack/.kube/config will cause this error:

+++ tools/gate/kubeadm/setup_gate.sh:source:31 :   sudo chown 1001:1001 /opt/stack/.kube/config
chown: cannot access '/opt/stack/.kube/config': No such file or directory

Change-Id: I8bcffb0f626d91072063e1ce6faced9f7a737a6b
"}, {'created': '2018-03-08 08:07:31.000000000', 'message': "kubeadm: fix issue about obtaining k8s config

We use ansible's become to do privilege escalation. However in this way
the $HOME path would be set to /root instead of the user running
devstack. Thus the k8s config would be kept under /root instead of the
$HOME directory of which runs devstack.

This commit fixes the aforementioned issue by directly copying the
config from /etc to the user's directory in setup_gate.sh after running
ansible and also avoids touching other places.

Co-Authored-By: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I8bcffb0f626d91072063e1ce6faced9f7a737a6b
"}, {'created': '2018-03-08 08:32:46.000000000', 'message': "kubeadm: fix issue about obtaining k8s config

We use ansible's become to do privilege escalation. However in this way
the $HOME path would be set to /root instead of the user running
devstack. Thus the k8s config would be kept under /root instead of the
$HOME directory of which runs devstack.

This commit fixes the aforementioned issue by directly copying the
config from /etc to the user's directory in setup_gate.sh after running
ansible.

Co-Authored-By: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I8bcffb0f626d91072063e1ce6faced9f7a737a6b
"}]
commit_message:
kubeadm: fix issue about obtaining k8s config

We use ansible's become to do privilege escalation. However in this way
the $HOME path would be set to /root instead of the user running
devstack. Thus the k8s config would be kept under /root instead of the
$HOME directory of which runs devstack.

This commit fixes the aforementioned issue by directly copying the
config from /etc to the user's directory in setup_gate.sh after running
ansible.

Co-Authored-By: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I8bcffb0f626d91072063e1ce6faced9f7a737a6b

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML

commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive a YAML
document from an untrusted source such as the Internet. The function
yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python objects like integers or
lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ifa91f90658a70dcedd00a3e036e3f241746e5bd1

commit_message:
Switch to stestr and wait for LB delete on cleanup

Switch tox.ini to directly call stestr instead of
testrepository which is not maintained.

Also skip a problematic test temporarily until we can resolve the larger
gate issues.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Icf1f9eb4539666dffb6c9c1651670541523a9f9e
(cherry picked from commit 69e092d06d15feb3cf87cef0198b634b65412b56)

commit_message:
Remove any extra newlines from upgrade script

When the upgrade script is generated, it is copied
from the deploy script. If it has any blank line it
is causing the generated upgrade script to fail, due to
the inclusion of these blank lines.

Change-Id: Ic8d80d3540eb4874ab9acadaaefc25c1a4064c53

commit_message:
Fixing incompatibility with openstacksdk 0.10 and higher

Before openstacksdk 0.10 the authenticator was automatically
created, but starting with 0.10 we need to pass on our own
authenticator.

Change-Id: I93cce4a7753c5e72957b71cd5cc7f7ecdef2956b
Closes-Bug: #1754250
(cherry picked from commit c9da0c6dd66cc4285b9945d7731ea0ece6a25502)

commit_message:
Fix test case in test_volume_unicode.py

The test case `test_snapshot_create_volume_description_non_ascii_code`
in test_volume_unicode.py breaks the CI job [1], as the test case makes
a wrong assumption that the 'descrption' of snapshot will be inherited
from source volume. This patch aims to fix it.

[1] legacy-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph

Change-Id: I038684acc488fb1ddba0daff348a23ebf45083da
Closes-Bug: #1736676

commit_message:
Update Provisioning Improvements

During the implementation phase of the Provisioning Improvements specs
an error in the calculation formula of the merged spec was discovered,
so the patch used the formula from a previous revision of the spec
patch.

The implementation also diverged in not adding a new configuration
option but overloading the existing one to support the `auto` option.

This patch updates the Provisioning Improvements specs to match the
implementation from change id If30bb6276f58532c0f78ac268544a8804008770e

Change-Id: Id4b7aa252ad0404d3038a1279e0d673a0809c7e8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 09:25:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix nodePort cannot be accessed when k8s fedora atomic vm reboot

When reboot k8s fedora atomic vm, iptables FORWARD rules change to DROP,
this cause nodeport cannot be accessed from outside.

Change-Id: I9c3dbbd571ff68e572f86ecde70861636da256cd
Closes-Bug: #1742088
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nodePort cannot be accessed when k8s fedora atomic vm reboot

When reboot k8s fedora atomic vm, iptables FORWARD rules change to DROP,
this cause nodeport cannot be accessed from outside.

Change-Id: I9c3dbbd571ff68e572f86ecde70861636da256cd
Closes-Bug: #1742088

commit_message:
Update our service definition

Clarify that we are the OpenStack Containers service as officially
defined in OpenStack governance [1].

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/governance/plain/
    reference/projects.yaml

Change-Id: Ibf554b37de55a5fe6f550fade9a5cd91ec67ac7c

commit_message:
Fix Docker-py 3.1.0 return generator

I've tested it in my local environment & it works.

$ pip install docker==3.1.0
$ tox -eall-plugin -- \
    zun_tempest_plugin.tests.\
    tempest.api.test_containers.\
    TestContainer.\
    test_run_container_with_image_driver_glance

Change-Id: I6b283024e70ad414f993d2d042f05eb988bdb7a4
Partial-Bug: #1753080

dancing, but that gets complicated.

Later patches can further clean the rest of the
internals up with the virt driver interfaces.

commit_message:
Rename the 'recreate' param in rebuild_instance to 'evacuate'

When recreate=True, we're evacuating during the
rebuild_instance method.

This is not obvious given the method name, so this
change renames the variable at the top of the method
and uses the new 'evacuate' variable throughout the
rest (except for a couple of noted places).

We could rename the parameter with some RPC version
dancing, but that gets complicated.

Later patches can further clean the rest of the
internals up with the virt driver interfaces.

Change-Id: Ib7276dd23f7c7ba7bd7afe37147a8479feb4b333

Imported Translations from Zanata

For more information about this automatic import see:

For image type function, we set the limit in pod definition for now,

commit_message:
Remove the resource limit for pod in k8s deployment

For non-image type function, it's the runtime server's reponsibility
to set resource limit for sub-process.

For image type function, we set the limit in pod definition for now,
may provide config option or input param in future.

Change-Id: I6c0e19759df0b964eb63839998327e55b4c4b092

commit_message:
Fix log format for oxygen logging

the way karaf logs are enabled is changed in oxygen onwards,
due to which there are no logs getting saved on oxygen gate
jobs. This patch makes log format compatible enough to work
for all existing snapshots.

Change-Id: Id5636801fabb99c4d1d4dd54fb0754bbd7236049

This commit switches to use a blacklist file to exclude tests. It's much
more explicit and less error prone than the giant regex used before.
Each line in the blacklist file is treated as a separate regex, and
after the initial set of tests to run is found (from any cli regex or
whitelist file regexes) tests that match an re.search on each line are
removed from that set.

commit_message:
Switch to a blacklist file for test excludes

This commit switches to use a blacklist file to exclude tests. It's much
more explicit and less error prone than the giant regex used before.
Each line in the blacklist file is treated as a separate regex, and
after the initial set of tests to run is found (from any cli regex or
whitelist file regexes) tests that match an re.search on each line are
removed from that set.

Change-Id: I83ec00dd80ada20b1cf7840d2110c68cba3d3efa
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/547606
Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <michel@redhat.com>
